La nueva planta de café estará dando frutos dentro de 2 años y para esta cosecha quiere renovar otra parte de su siembra así como comprar fertilizantes. Con estas acciones que hoy está realizando, Severo aumentará a 10 toneladas su producción en un lapso de 4 años.
texts.en: Last year, Severo replanted part of his coffee plantation, thanks to the loan that he received partially from Kiva, which he repaid at the end of the harvest. The new coffee plants will be producing within two years, and for this harvest, Severo wants to replant another part of his land as well as purchase fertilizer. In doing this, Severo will add 10 metric tons to his production over the course of four years.

loans.use: rejuvenate his plantation and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Hernandez Elio

texts.es: El señor Hernández, tiene 50 años de edad, es soltero por viudez, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Yoro. El tiene un negocio desde hace 12 años de  venta de mercadería, ofrece variedad de productos como ropa, calzado, plásticos y ropa de cama. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante. Además le gusta la agricultura y ganadería.  El préstamo que solicito es por 20,000 Lempiras el cual los invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera y también para generar ingresos al negocio. Su sueño es colocar el negocio en un lugar estratégico y poder darles calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Hernández, is 50 years old, a widower who has two children. They live in the municipality of Yoro. For the past twelve years he has run a business as a street seller, offering a variety of products such as clothing, shoes, plastic articles and bedding.  He also likes agriculture and livestock raising. Hernández is asking for a loan of 20,000 Lempiras which he will use to buy a milk cow and also to generate revenue for his business. His dream is to move his business to a strategic location, thereby being able to offer a higher standard of living to his children.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to generate other income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, sugar, meat and other necessary things to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga is 34 years old and married to Rizal, and they live happily in the village of San Ambrocio. The couple was blessed with three children. To earn a living, Olga is engaged in a retailing business, primarily selling “pandesal" (baked bread) around their village. Usually during coffee breaks, "pandesal" is a perfect match to a cup of coffee. She usually earns 300 PHP daily from the mere selling of "pandesal". Now, Olga is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP as additional business capital to buy "pandesal" and other assorted types of bread to resell. Through the business, Olga hopes that she will be able to alleviate her family's living difficulties especially in sending her children to school and meeting their daily necessities.

loans.use: to buy "pandesal" and other assorted types of bread to resell.

loans.name: Tineimala

texts.en: Tineimala is 42 years old and married with five children. She has just joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial services. Tinei has been sewing for many years and has decided to use this skill to operate a business. She will use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine, rolls of fabric, zippers, needles, threads, tape measure, scissors and oil. Her profits will be used to repurchase things needed for the business and assist with the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, rolls of fabric, zippers, needles, threads, tape measure, scissors and oil.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Hog-raising is the primary source of income for Gemma and her family. Gemma is now 30 years old and is married with two children. She has been managing her hog-raising business for three years. She wanted to have more hogs to raise, but she lacks the necessary capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, vaccines and hog feed for their growth and maintenance. She hopes that she will obtain her desired amount of loan to invest toward her business development.

loans.use: to buy piglets, vaccines and hog feed

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is from the village of Sto. Nino, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 26 years old, married and has three children. Eduard owns and operates a business offering motor transport services. Eduard has been engaged in his business for two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it. He has worked as a security guard in a private company to earn a living.

In 2010, Eduard joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduard is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy a new set of tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Gloria hace 11 años trabajaba para una empresa dedicada a la fabricación y venta de velas, para el sostenimiento diario en su hogar. 
Ella con una mentalidad emprendedora y con el ánimo de generar mayores ingresos, decide crear su propio negocio de velas, empezó a fabricarlas en su casa y venderlas a sus amigas, vecinos y familiares, desde entonces ha crecido tanto el negocio que ya le vende a iglesias, almacenes y organizadores de eventos.
Gloria está pidiendo el crédito para poder comprar maquinaria que fabrica velas de 1,4 y materia prima (cera, mecha, decorados, envolturas), para así generar un crecimiento positivo para el negocio
texts.en:
Gloria has been making and selling candles for the past twelve years in order to support her household. She has an enterprising spirit and with the intention to generate income she decided to start her own candle business. She started to make them in her house and sell them to her friends, neighbors and others she knew. The business has grown so much since then, she now sells to churches, pharmacies and event organizers. 

Gloria is asking for this loan in order to buy machinery to make candles and buy raw materials (wax, wicks, decorations, wrapping) to create a positive growth in her business.

loans.use: to buy machinery and raw materials.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 36 years old and married with two children. To make a living, she operates a buy-and-sell business selling fish in the market while her husband goes fishing. She has been engaged in her business for years and earns 8,000 PHP a month for this activity. 

In 2008, Merlinda joined GDMPC. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing pump boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her existing pump boat.

loans.name: Moisesina

texts.en: Moisesina is 55 years old and single. Moisesina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to resell. Moisesina has been in this business for 13 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Moisesina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 52 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leah is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

Leah has been farming rice for 25 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona is 51 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leona runs a mobile vending grocery in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as rice, salt, sugar, soap, shampoo and other grocery items to sell.

In the future Leona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, salt, sugar, soap, shampoo and other grocery items

loans.name: Toeaso

texts.en: Toeaso is 41 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling sandwiches, cold drinks and coffee in her community. She and her husband operated a food business at the flea market, but because of renovations, they are required to move. That is why they have opted to open a stall of their own at their village. To do this, she needs a loan to buy boxes of tinned fish, mayonnaise, sugar, coffee, milk, cordial, plastic cups and spoons, wrappers, etc. In the future, Toeaso hopes to own a cafe. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy various items for her food stall.

loans.name: Masjid Abu Hurera Group

texts.en:
Shabana, age 30, is a married woman. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw, but his earnings were so poor, so she started tailoring in her home. She has been doing this for the past five years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. She also deals in the business of clothing sales to generate an extra amount of income. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, she has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine as well as some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to pay for personal expenses. Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Shabana is raising her hand in the given picture.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 34 years old and married with one child.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like milk, soap, spices, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and earns an income from buying and selling fish and selling purified water.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like milk, soap, spices, canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Ria is married and has three children. She is 33 years old and resides in Mialen, Clarin. Her husband works in a private company to earn a living.

Ria raises pigs to sell to support her family's daily needs. Through this, she gains a monthly income of PHP 6,000. She has been in this business for more than five years. She requested a new loan of PHP 11,000 from Gata Daku MPC to purchase livestock feed.

She wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old and married with five children. She lives in Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She operates a local firewood business, selling to customers in the community. She's been with her business for more than two years and earns PHP 1,500 each month. Her husband owns a motor transportation service to earn a living. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2012. 

Marilou is requesting a new loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw materials to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. Kate has been in this business for over 10 years. Kate earns more income from farming rice. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. Kate has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Taipapau

texts.en: Taipapau is 29 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a sack of flour, box of chicken, yeast, soya sauce, garlic, onion, etc. In the future, Taipapau hopes to extend/improve her business. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pork buns.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Tapatonu

texts.en:
Tapatonu is 63 years old and married with five children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Tapatonu needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, file, bush knife, digging stick, pickaxe, chemicals, fertilizer, work gloves and boots for her business.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Tapatonu will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, file, bush knife, digging stick, pickaxe, chemicals, fertilizer, work gloves and boots

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is from Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marlon works in a private company and during weekends and free time, he provides transportation services to local community members. Marlon has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Marlon joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP to acquire another unit of motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to acquire another unit of motorcycle

loans.name: Nollie

texts.en:
Nollie is a 64-year-old widow with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nollie has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like cloth, needles, thread, etc. to use for her tailoring.

Nollie has been in this business for 46 years. In the future, Nollie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like cloth, needles, thread, etc. to use for her tailoring

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Silanga, Tangub City. Marife works as a collector in a private company and at the same time helps her husband to manage a gardening business to earn a living; she has had this business for more than two years. Marife has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. She has requested a new loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she hopes to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Con un crédito de Kiva Miguel Ángel pudo comprar planta de café y fertilizantes para renovar su finca durante la cosecha pasada. La planta que sembró estará dando frutos dentro de tres años y con esto aumentará su cosecha a 10 toneladas. Para esta cosecha Miguel Ángel necesita de otro financiamiento por parte de Kiva ya que nuevamente comprará fertilizante y también utilizará parte de ese dinero para el pago de trabajadores que lo ayuden a hacer algunas actividades en su parcela. Con las ganancias que obtenga el final de la cosecha Miguel Ángel pagará este crédito.
texts.en:
With a Kiva loan, Miguel Ángel was able to purchase coffee plants and fertilizer to renovate his farm during the last harvest. The plants that he sowed will be producing fruit within three years, and with this, he will increase his harvest to 10 tons. 

For the current harvest, Miguel Ángel needs another loan on Kiva’s part, as he will be purchasing fertilizer again. He will also use part of this money to pay workers who help him to do some work on his plot of land. With the earnings that he will obtain at the end of the harvest, Miguel Ángel will pay off this loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda, 45 years old, is a mother who is willing to sacrifice everything just to give her children a better life. She is engaged in the transportation business using their motorcycle. She has been in this business for four years. This time, she wants to borrow a loan in the amount of PHP 11,000 to buy spare parts, oil and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Having this financial assistance from lenders, Imelda hopes to improve her daily income from the transport service she is offering to further meet their daily necessities.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, oil and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Santa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora  Santa de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación, ubicada en la comunidad de la cuesta, Nacaome   al sur de Honduras, dedicándose a su actividad que es la venta de cuajada, mantequilla, queso y  cargas de leña.
Doña Santa sus clientes son personas que visita en diferentes partes de San Lorenzo y Nacaome, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años y está muy contenta de trabajar con Prima ya que  por medio de los créditos que se le han dado a podido mejorar un poco su  calidad de vida de y la de su familia.
Doña Santa solicita el préstamo de 9,000.00 lempiras para la compra de más botellas para almacenar la leche y leña ya que tiene varios clientes que le han encargado producto. 
Doña Santa con el apoyo del préstamo pretende seguir invirtiendo más en su negocio y seguir creciendo para darle un futuro mejor a su familia.
Doña Santa su sueño es poder aumentar más su clientela y que su negocio le genere los suficientes ingresos para salir adelante con sus Hijos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2013
texts.en:
34-year-old Santa lives with her husband in the community of La Cuesta, Nacaome, in the southern part of Honduras. She makes a living by selling cuajada [a type of soft cheese], butter, cheese, and firewood.

Santa’s clients are people who visit different parts of San Lorenzo and Nacaome. She has been doing this for ten years and is very happy to work with Prisma as she has been able to improve her family’s quality of life, as well as her own, a little through the loans Prisma has given her.

Santa is requesting a loan of 9,000 HNL in order to purchase firewood and more bottles for storing milk since she has several clients who have ordered her products. 

With the support of the loan, Santa will try to continue investing more in her business and continue growing to give her family a better future. 

Santa’s dream is to be able to increase her clientele so that her business will generate enough income for her and her children to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase bottles and firewood for her business

loans.name: Rogaciano

texts.es: con en crédito obtenido por kiva la cosecha pasada Rogaciano pudo comprar plantas para reforestar parte de su finca ya que haciendo esto en unos años tendrá plantas jóvenes dando una muy buena producción también pudo comprar fertilizantes químicos que le ayudaron aumentar su producción dando como resultado que en la cosecha pasada haya tenido buenos resultados y de esa manera se puedo ayudar para poner en marcha su proyecto de poner una tienda. Para esta nueva etapa Rogaciano solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayudaran a que sus plantas crezcan y aumentar su producción también necesita para el pago de jornales ya que tiene que contratar gente para que le ayuden en la limpia y poda de su finca.
texts.en:
Rogaciano used his Kiva loan during the last harvest to buy plants to reforest his plantation.  Doing this, in a few years the young plants also will be producing abundantly.  He also bought chemical fertilizers to help increase production so the last harvest gave him a good profit, allowing him to begin the business project he had of opening a store.

For this new phase, Rogaciano is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizers that will help his plants grow and increase production.  He will also hire workers to clean and prune the plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to increase crop production and to hire workers to clean the fields.

loans.name: Álvaro Crúz

texts.es:
Álvaro tiene 53 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Cuenta con 30 años de experiencia en la agricultura, específicamente en maíz y frijol. Aprendió el oficio de su padre quien fue agricultor toda su vida. Se recuerda que su padre lo llevaba a trabajar a las algodoneras y a las milpas, cuando tenia aproximadamente doce años de edad. Álvaro, comenta que ha sido agricultor y espera seguir siéndolo durante el resto de su vida.

Se traslada desde su comunidad hasta la cuidad, que esta aproximadamente a ocho kilómetros de distancia.  Camina tres kilómetros debido a que no hay transporte donde él vive, sale a la carretera el litoral y aborda un autobús que lo conduce a la cuidad. Ahí compra los insumos y materiales que utilizara. Una vez los compra hace el mismo recorrido hasta su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar la semilla, fertilizantes, herbicidas,  una bomba de aspersión y poder realizar la siembra de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Debido, a que no tiene recursos para sembrar y comprar los insumos. Y con la producción obtenida podrá disponible maíz para consumo familiar y el resto guardarlo y venderlo en la época que tiene buen precio. Así generar ingresos para comprar alimentos para  su familia.

Él espera mejorar la condición de vida. Tiene el sueño de construir su propia vivienda y poder cavar un pozo para cultivar en época de verano, y poder sembrar hortalizas.
texts.en:
Álvaro, 53, has a common-law wife and two children.  For 30 years he has worked in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  He learned the trade from his father who was a farmer all his life.  He remembers that his father would take him with him to work on the cotton and corn plantations when he was about 12 years old.  Álvaro says he has always been a farmer and hopes to be one for the rest of his life.

He travels from his community to the city, which is about eight kilometers away, to buy farm supplies and materials.  He walks three kilometers because there is no transportation where he lives, and catches a bus on the costal road that will take him to the city.  After purchasing his supplies he does the same thing to get home.

The loan Álvaro is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, a spray pump and to pay for planting 7,000 m2 of corn, because he does not have the resources.  He will use the corn he produces for family consumption and to put away until he can sell it at a good price during the right season.  He will use the income to buy food for his family.

He wants to improve his lifestyle and one day build his own home, as well as dig a well to cultivate in the summer months and grow vegetables.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and a spray pump, and to plant 7,000 m2 of corn.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar, de 54 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo con quien vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Oscar es la agricultura, para eso cuenta con un terreno de 10 hectáreas de extensión que compró hace 8 años. Tiene instalado 5 hectáreas de plátano y 2 hectáreas de cocona que se encuentran en pleno crecimiento. Trabaja con la ayuda de dos obreros quienes se encargan de las labores de siembra y cosecha. Eventualmente siembra también maíz, yuca u otros productos regionales de gran demanda.
Le gusta su actividad ya que le genera los ingresos económicos necesarios para mantener y solventar los gastos de su hogar, comenta que escogió este trabajo por la necesidad de tener un oficio que le genere los recursos necesarios para vivir tranquilamente ya que no tiene ninguna formación académica, en la actualidad tiene planes de seguir con su labor y ampliar la extensión de su área de siembra y plantar otro tipo de cultivos de mayor producción que le ayuden a mejorar su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará abono orgánico y semillas de cocona y plátano los cuales requiere para establecer una nueva campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Oscar, 54, is married, has a son and lives with his family in his own home.  He is a farmer and has a 10-acre plot of land that he bought eight years ago.  He cultivates five acres of bananas and two acres of cocona (tip) that are in full production.  He hires two workers who do the planting and harvesting.  Eventually he will plant corn, yucca and other regional crops that are in much demand.

Oscar enjoys his work because he is able to make enough income to support his family and cover household expenses.  He says he chose this line of work because he needed something that would generate enough resources to live quietly without having any academic training.  

His current plans are to continue with his activity and expand his plantation to include other types of crops aimed at improving his economy.  

On this occasion, he is requesting 2,000 PEN and is content knowing he can count on this financial support as it will allow him to advance in his business.  He is also committed to paying back the loan on time.  He plans to use the loan to buy organic fertilizer and cocona and banana seeds for the upcoming planting season.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and cocona (tip) and banana seeds.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Gracias a un crédito de Kiva que obtuvo el año pasado Raúl pudo realizar todos los trabajos necesarios en su finca de café pues renovó algunas plantas y compró fertilizantes. Desafortunadamente no pudo realizar unos arreglos en su casa porque se enfermó y lo tuvieron que operar, sin embargo ya se encuentra recuperado de su salud. Para este año nuevamente comprará fertilizantes y realizará algunas labores en su finca por lo que otra vez solicita un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Thanks to the Kiva loan he had last year, Raúl was able to carry out the necessary work on his coffee plantation, renovating some plants and buying fertilizers.  Unfortunately, he could not fix up his house because he fell ill and had an operation, but has now recovered his health.

This year he will buy fertilizers again and do some work on the plantation, so he is requesting a loan that he will pay back at the end of harvest time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and clean the fields.

loans.name: William Abelardo

texts.es:
william, tiene 28 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Se dedica a trabajar en un agroservicio,desde hace 3 años, él comenta que ha trabajado de todo, 4 años en un taller de reparación de llantas, trabajo 2 años en una fabrica de confección de ropa, trabajo vendiendo ropa ambulante un año; pero desde hace  tres años trabaja en el agroservicio, es un poco agitado, debe levantarse a las cinco de la mañana,para prepararse,luego se conduce, a pie para el trabajo que le queda a dos cuadras de  su casa,donde trabaja doce horas y regresa a las seis de la tarde, a su casa,aunque un poco cansado, pero su deseo es que no le falte nada a su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es  para comprar 500 ladrillos, 2 quintales de hierro,20 bolsas de cemento para construir una habitación, ya que vive con su papá en la misma casa y así tendrá más privacidad. 

su sueño es tener su propio negocio,construir su casa grande, y que su hijo se gradué de la universidad, para que se gane la vida de otra manera.
texts.en:
William, 28, lives with his common-law wife and son.  He has been working for three years at an agroservice activity.  He says he has done just about everything: working four years at a tire repair workshop, two years in a clothing factory, one year as a clothing vendor, and three years in agroservice.  He is very busy and must get up at 5:00 a.m. to get ready and walk to work about two blocks away.  He works 12 hours and returns home at 6:00 p.m.  Although he is a little tired he does not want his family to go without anything.

The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy 500 bricks, 200 lbs. of iron and 20 bags of cement to build a room.  He lives with his father in the same house and would like to have more privacy.

His dream is to have his own business, build a bigger house and see his son graduate from the university so he can earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy 500 bricks, 200 lbs of iron and 20 bags of cement to build a room.

loans.name: Fiapaipai

texts.en: Fiapaipai is a 22 year old single woman. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Fiapaipai needs a loan to buy boxes of mutton, chicken, sausages, soya sauce, onion, garlic, pepper, plastic plates, foil, and a gas oven. She plans to use her profits to extend her family home. Fiapaipai has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy boxes of mutton, chicken, sausages, soya sauce, onion, garlic, pepper, plastic plates, foil, and a gas oven.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en: Molly is a 40 year old married woman with 4 children. She makes and sells banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Molly needs a loan to buy oil, plastic bags, salt, a frying pan, big containers, bananas and tongs. She plans to use her profits to save for her children's school fees. Molly has been a member of SPBD since 2009

loans.use: to buy oil, plastic bags, salt, a frying pan, big containers, bananas and tongs

loans.name: Mary Cres

texts.en: Mary Cres is 17 years old and lives in Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is an Information Technology student at Mindanao University of Science and Technology. Her parents have five dependents that need financial support. She helps her parents by working in their business on weekends and she also has part time employment in order to gain additional income. She has requested a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to pay school tuition fees. She is hoping to finish her studies and to improve her condition in the near future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Felemino

texts.en:
For several years farming has been the only source of income for Felemino’s family. They are harmoniously residing in the village of Simanu Norte. Felemino is married and has children. He and his wife work together on their farm to earn more income.

Felemino has decided to enlarge his crop cultivating activities and he is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 in order to buy rice seedlings and organize cultivation works.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings and organize cultivation work.

loans.name: Nor-Aina

texts.en:
Nor-aina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nor-aina has been in this business for 9 years. Nor-aina earns more income from raising ducks and cows.

Nor-aina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Percie

texts.en:
Percie is 41 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Percie is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her ducks.

Percie has been raising ducks for 6 years and earns additional income from selling fermented duck eggs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Maria Rebeca

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años, es madre soltera, ella soñaba con terminar sus estudios, pero la falta de recursos económicos en su hogar no le permitió cumplir esta meta, llegando a terminar solamente la escuela primaria y ése ha sido un obstáculo que le ha impedido avanzar laboralmente.
Sin embargo ahora ella lucha por sus 3 hijas de 29, 27 y 17 años, a quienes ha sostenido con la ayuda de sus padres. María es una mujer de campo, desde pequeña aprendió las labores de agricultura y ganadería  junto a sus padres, en sus tiempos libres ella disfruta mucho sembrar hortalizas, tejer y caminar por la finca. Ella vive con sus hijas y también con sus padres Cristóbal de 78 años y Josefina de 79 en Los Bancos un cantón de la Provincia de Pichincha, una de las provincias  más grandes en la República del Ecuador. Este cantón se encuentra a pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Quito, y tiene diversidad de bosques, además sus barrios están poblados con gente amable y costumbres propias de esta ciudad. María y su familia viven en una zona alejada del pueblo, en la finca que también es su campo de trabajo. 
María emprendió con el negocio de la ganadería apenas nació su primera hija, es decir, hace 29 años, invierte al menos 12 horas cada día en el cuidado, aseo, alimentación y ordeño de las vacas, además ella se encarga de purificar la leche y elaborar productos lácteos como yogurt casero, quesillo, dulces, etc. Es un trabajo que ella disfruta hacerlo a pesar de que en la época de invierno el clima no sea favorable y menos en horas de la madrugada cuando ella comienza siempre sus labores. Ella solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de abono, fertilizantes y semillas que mejoren los pastizales donde se alimentan las vacas, pues el invierno pasado no los dejó en buenas condiciones y ella necesita que las vacas estén bien alimentadas para que produzcan una leche de calidad y además para mantenerlas en buen estado de salud. Este préstamo ayudará a que María y su familia tengan la estabilidad económica y laboral que les ayuda a cubrir el sustento de sus necesidades básicas. María agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo y asesoría que le han brindado y además por hacer partícipes a varias personas en el mundo de su crecimiento a través de Kiva. María espera mejorar cada día de tal forma que un día pueda cubrir los gastos para arreglar la finca y la vivienda que tienen algunos problemas de construcción.
texts.en:
María, 46, is single. Her dream was to finish her studies, but due to the lack of resources at home she could not fulfill this goal. She could only attend primary school, which has become an obstacle for her to find better job opportunities. However, she fights for her three daughters, who are 29, 27 and 17 years old. She has provided for them with the help of her parents.

María is a countrywoman. She learned to work in agriculture and cattle raising when she was a small girl, together with her parents. During her free time, she enjoys growing vegetables, weaving and walking around her farm. She lives together with her daughters and her parents Cristóbal, 78, and Josefina, 79, in Los Bancos, a canton located in the province of Pichincha, one of the largest provinces of the Republic of Ecuador. This canton is located close to Quito and has many forests. Its neighborhoods are inhabited by kind people with their original traditions. María and her family live far from the town, in a farm that is also their workplace.

María started a livestock business right when her first daughter was born, i.e. 29 years ago. She works at least 12 hours every day cleaning, feeding and milking her cows. She also purifies the milk and makes products such as homemade yogurt, cottage cheese and sweets. She enjoys working with these activities, even if the weather is not pleasant during the winter time, especially in the early morning when she starts working.

María is requesting a loan to buy compost, fertilizers and seeds to improve the pastures, since they were ruined during the winter season and she needs to feed her cows in order to produce good-quality milk and to keep them healthy. This loan will help María and her family to have a stable economy and work in order to cover their basic needs. María is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the support and advice they have given her and for letting people from all over the world be part of her progress through Kiva. María hopes to improve every day in order to be able to pay for some improvements that her farm and her house need.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the maintenance of her pastures.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts, motorcycle accessories and gasoline for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a lady who is 30 years old and married to Timothy. She is a mother of three children. She raises chickens and also does knitting in Limuru. Faith has been in this business for five years now and earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES.

This will be Faith's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy chicken feed. In the future, she wants to be a successful businesswoman and large-scale farmer. She also hopes to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Swayifi

texts.en:
Swayifi is a 30-year-old man who lives in the outskirts of the main town. He has two children whom he takes care of along with one other person who is the sister of his wife.

Swayifi is a shopkeeper who has a retail business selling daily use items such as sugar, salt, posho, etc.

He also does some agricultural work on his farm where he produces food for home consumption; he does some cattle farming on the same land.

Swayifi says he managed to use the previous loan to put up his own structure where he has his shop. Through this, he has managed to save money that would have been used for other expenses. 

Swayifi started the shop six years back to improve his household income.

He says that he intends to use the loan to buy more stock for his shop so as to attract more clients who keep asking for items that he has not stocked.

Swayifi commends Ugafode for helping him acquire land that he has so far used to cultivate seasonal crops such as beans and groundnuts. This has helped him boost his income.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items for sell.

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es:
Sandra una persona emprendedora desde siempre, quien ha emprendido varios negocios con el fin de encontrar una sostenibilidad económica y sobre todo poder dedicar su tiempo a su hijo de 12 años, está incursionando en el mundo de la belleza con sus servicios a domicilios de cepillado, maquillaje, arreglo de uñas, etc. Con el cual ha generado ingresos para sostener su hogar.
Espera crecer mucho más su negocio y en un futuro poder tener su propio local de belleza y posicionarse en el mercado
El crédito será utilizado para adquirir los muebles, equipos y productos de belleza (maquillaje, plancha, sprays, cremas de peinar, etc.)
texts.en:
Sandra has always been an enterprising person. She has started several businesses, in search of economic stability and free time to spend with her 12-year-old son. She is making an incursion into the beauty industry with home-visiting services, such as hairstyling, make up, manicure and pedicure, etc. This has helped her to receive an income and maintain her family.

Sandra hopes to expand her business and in the future have her own beauty salon and earn a place in the market. She will use this loan to buy furniture, equipment and beauty products (make up, a hair iron, sprays, combing creams, etc.).

loans.use: to buy furniture, equipment and beauty products.

loans.name: Gleidys

texts.es: Gleidys, a sus 27 años de edad es casada y madre de un hijo de 11 años. Su vida productiva la ha dedicado a trabajar en empresas de confección, en el área administrativa, pero poco a poco, fue aprendiendo la parte operativa y así fue adquiriendo experiencia, ella laboró durante 8 años aproximadamente, con lo que pudo adquirir recursos para aportar con el sustento para su hogar. Con el ánimo de salir adelante y progresar, con su actitud empredendora y motivada por su familia, decidió independizarse y quiere iniciar su propio taller de confección a terceros, para lo cual solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en el pago de las máquinas por valor de $4.000.000, pago de asesoría especializada por $574.200, compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, encajes, botones, cierres) por valor de $1.000.000 y pago de estudio de crédito y seguro por $225.800, para un total de $5.800.000. Con el apoyo de este crédito podrá ejercer la actividad y generar ingresos para el sustento familiar, además se dará a conocer en el sector, lo que le permitirá en un mediano plazo poder tener su línea propia y montar un punto de venta donde ofrezca sus prendas, así logrará tener una mejor calidad de vida y darle un excelente educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Gleidys, 27, is married and has an 11-year-old son. She has worked in the clothing industry, for the administrative department. However, little by little, she learned about more operative activities and gained experience. She worked for approximately eight years and made enough to help maintaining her family. 

With the intention to progress and get ahead and her enterprising spirit, and motivated by her family, she decided to start her own business, making clothes for third parties. She is requesting a loan in order to buy machines (COP 4,000,000), pay for specialized consultancy services (COP 574,200), buy supplies in bulk (fabrics, threads, laces, buttons, zippers) (COP 1,000,000) and pay for the administrative costs of the loan and the insurance (COP 225,800); i.e., COP 5,800,000 in total.

With this loan, she will be able to work and generate an income to maintain her family. She will also be able to promote her business locally, something that will help her to have her own brand and open a store where she can sell her garments. All this will result in a better quality of life and the possibility of offering her son an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and supplies in bulk, and to pay for consultancy services and administrative costs.

loans.name: Geraldine Tibizay

texts.es:
Desde niña Geraldine le ha gustado dibujar, y cuenta con una creatividad que le ha servido para crear y hacer diferentes tipos de tarjetas, detalles y artículos para decoración. Cuando salió del colegio empezó a trabajar en un almacén de detalles, hasta que por su situación de embarazo decidió trabajar desde su casa, desde entonces ella maneja su propia tienda de detalles y decoración, ayudándole a muchas personas con sus servicios decorativos. Generando de este modo un sostenimiento para su hogar y sus dos hijos 
Geraldine sueña con tener una gran empresa de distribución de este tipo de artículos a nivel nacional
El crédito lo invertirá en confitería, material de decoración e icopor
texts.en:
Since she was a child, Geraldine has liked drawing. She has a creativity that has served her to create and make different types of cards, accessories and decorative items. When she left high school, she started to work in an accessories store until due to her pregnancy she decided to work at home. Since then, she has run her own store selling accessories and decorative items, helping a lot of people with her decorating service. In this way, she generates support for her home and her two children.

Geraldine dreams of having a great distribution business for this type of item at the national level. She will invest the loan in buying candy, decoration materials and polystyrene.

loans.use: to buy candy, decoration materials and polystyrene.

loans.name: Ana Aida

texts.es:
Ana tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Es una persona humilde y trabajadora que se dedica cuidar y dar educación a sus hijos y además administrar el negocio de teja que tiene la familia esta labor la realiza con su esposo; ya que de él aprendió como administrar y echar adelante la producción. Antes de que ella aprendiera como administrar la tejera se dedicaba a cuidar a sus hijos; pero viendo la necesidad de su esposo que no alcanzaba a cubrir todo el trabajo tomo la iniciativa de aprender y ayudarlo.

Los materiales que utiliza para la producción de teja como lo es la tierra y  barro los adquiere buscando en lugares donde se encuentre ya que se necesita tener el conocimiento de las clase de tierra y barro buenas para tener una buena producción es por ello que su esposo se encarga de buscarlos y transportarlos en camión para el lugar donde se fabrican las tejas.

El dinero  de este crédito será destinado para pagar el trabajo realizado de las personas que se encargan de la elaboración de la teja, ya que la producción no se ha vendido aún y se necesita cancelar el pago de estos trabajadores y poder solventar así esta necesidad.

Se estará apoyando al cliente a que pueda invertir en el pago de las labores realizadas por los trabajadores y así tenga la oportunidad de seguir adelante con su producción sin afectar las necesidades de sus trabajadores y los ingresos de su familia.

Mejorara sus capacidades económicas gracias al apoyo que hoy le brinda fundación campo, podrá cancelar la necesidad de poder cancelar y así poder obtener una mejor producción y mejorar así sus ingresos.

Ella planea que después de cancelar este crédito dejar las puertas abiertas en la fundación para poder solventar cualquier otra necesidad crediticia cuando se necesite; como por ejemplo cubrir los gastos universitarios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old. She is married and has three children. She is a humble and hardworking person who raises and educates her children and runs a tile business that her family has. She does the work with her husband. It was from him that she learned to manage and move production forward. Before she learned to manage the tile factory she took care of her children, but when she saw that her husband needed help because he couldn't do all of the work himself, she took the initiative to learn and help him. 

The materials she uses to produce the tiles are earth and clay. She acquires them by looking in places where they are found, and she needs knowledge of all types of soil and clay to have a good production. That is why her husband takes care of seeking them out and bringing them by truck to the place where they make the tiles.

The money from this loan will be used to pay for the labor of the people who make the tiles. The product hasn't sold yet and the workers need to be paid and this expenses has to be covered. 

The client will be helped to invest in paying for the worker's labor and thus have the opportunity to get ahead with her production without affecting the workers' needs and the family income.

The support given to her by Fundacion Campo will improve her financial capacity. She will be able to pay off an expense and thus obtain better production and income. 

After paying off this loan, she plans on leaving the door open to getting any other loan she needs from the foundation for any other expense, for example, for her children's college education.

loans.use: to pay for the labor of the people who make the tiles. The product hasn't sold yet and the workers need to be paid.

loans.name: Wilmer Santiago

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 29 años, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos, creció en el campo y luego de terminar la escuela primaria se dedicó a trabajar con sus padres en el terreno aprendiendo sobre todo tipo de cultivos. 
Este joven emprendedor vive en Santo Domingo, un puerto importante para el comercio del Ecuador, pues es el lugar en donde se une la Región Sierra y Costa del país, por lo que es justamente aquí en donde se intercambian los productos para que vayan a las distintas ciudades. Wilmer está orgulloso de ser nativo de esta ciudad, pues el clima trópico – húmedo favorece a la agricultura por lo que sus tierras albergan los frutos más exquisitos demandados en todo el mundo. 
Siempre trabajando en fincas grandes, Wilmer adquirió la experiencia suficiente para ser un experto de los árboles y tierras, así que hace 6 años se independizó y asumió la administración del terreno de sus padres, trabajo al cual invierte la mayoría de horas del día en las labores que cada cultivo necesita. Tiene plantados maracuyá, plátanos, cacao y otros frutos de primera necesidad, sin embargo, Wilmer ha visto la necesidad de abonar el terreno para poder sembrar nuevos frutos e incrementar su producción y la calidad de los cultivos existentes, para lo cual Wilmer solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en su totalidad con la compra de este abono. 
Wilmer agradece a Fundación Alternativa la confianza que le han dado para crecer laboralmente y además por creer en él y sus proyectos futuros, pues el hecho de ayudarle con el préstamo le motiva a él para trabajar más fuerte para obtener los mejores resultados. 
Wilmer afirma que la falta de capital siempre fue un problema y conseguir financiamiento no siempre fue fácil, sin embargo ahora el apoyo a los microempresarios ha crecido y es gracias a proyectos como el de Kiva que involucra a varias personas alrededor del mundo para cooperar con cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 29 years old. He is single and has 2 children. He grew up in the country and after finishing primary school started working with his parents on the land, learning about all types of crops.
 
The young entrepreneur lives in Santo Domingo, an important port of commerce in Ecuador. It is the place where the Coast and Sierra regions meet. That is why it is there that products are traded to go to different cities. Wilmer is proud of being a native of this city. The tropical humid climate favors agriculture and its land grows the most delicious products, demanded around the world. 

Always working on big farms, Wilmer acquired enough experience to be an expert on trees and soil. So 6 years ago, he went off on his own and began managing his parents' land. He invests most of the hours of his day on the work that each crop needs. He grows passion fruit, plantains, cacao, and other staple products. Nonetheless, Wilmer needs to fertilize the land to be able to plant new products and increase the yield and quality of the existing crops.   To do that, Wilmer is asking for a loan that he will invest totally in buying the fertilizer. 

Wilmer is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa for the trust they have put in them to grow in his work as well as for believing in him and his future projects.  The fact that they are helping him with the loan motivates him to work harder to obtain better results. 

Wilmer affirms that the lack of capital has always been a problem and getting financing hasn't always been easy. Nonetheless, now the support for micro-businesspeople has grown and it is thanks to projects like Kiva that involve many people from around the world cooperating with each of them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her land.

loans.name: Libertadores Group

texts.es: La Sra. Viviana   de 31 años soltera  y con 1 hijos, la Sra. Viviana  se dedica ya hace 10 años al servicio de cosmetología en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Viviana  ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijo, Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que sus hijo sea  profesional es por eso  que la Sra. Viviana  trabaja mucho , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más cosméticos de belleza  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la Sra. Viviana es la que está en el medio, se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en: Viviana is 31 years old, single, and has one child. Viviana has worked in cosmetology for 10 years in a small locale, every day, with the goal of getting ahead and being able to pay for her son to get higher education. Thanks to her hard work, Viviana has improved her home and has supported her son's education. Her biggest wishes are to be able to continue to improve her business, and to see her son with a professional career one day, which is why she works so hard. With the loan, she will purchase more cosmetics and be able to earn more money. Viviana connects Kiva and Edaprospo and sends a hug to each as she signs off, as well as adding that she is thankful for the loan and all that it will make possible for her.

loans.use: purchase more beauty products.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 30 years old, married to Esther, and they have one child aged five years. He is in the transport business  in Nakuru, a business he has operated for the past three years. He earns earns an average income of KES 30,000 per month.

Simon has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD and intends to buy a motorbike with the loan amount. With anticipated profit, he plans to repay the loan and improve his living standards.

He hopes to buy a small car, a 'tuktuk', for a taxi in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a 'buy and sell' rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional rice grains to sell for her business.

Soledad has been in this business for three years. Soledad earns more income from buying and selling dried fish and from farming rice.

Soledad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional rice grains to sell

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is 26-year-old single man from Gaza.

He chose to take a loan to expand his shop to increase his income.

Amer used to work as a house painter, but as the demand for his work decreased he needed to find another source of income so he decided to open his own shop in his family house.

Amer's biggest challenge is the high prices of goods, because they come from Egypt and he has to pay a lot of taxes.

The next step for Amer is to buy refrigerators and a open a produce section.

loans.use: to buy goods for his retail shop

loans.name: Sabrin

texts.en:
Sabrin is a 24-year-old single woman from Jenin and the owner of a clothes shop.

A year ago she opened her shop from her personal savings, and decided to take a loan to get more clothes and to expand her business.

Sabrin's future goal is to finish her B.A. degree and to expand her shop.

Competition in the clothing market is the biggest challenge for Sabrin, as there are many clothes store in the city.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes shop

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 26-year-old single man from Gaza. He chose to take a loan to expand his shop and to buy goods.

A few years ago, Ahmed opened his store from his own savings, and his looking forward opening a big supermarket.

His biggest challenge is power outages and high prices.

loans.use: To buy goods for his shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old, married to John, and they have two children aged 10 and 6 years old. She has practiced  mixed farming in Nyahururu for the past three years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy feed for her cows. She anticipates to buy more cows for milk sales.  

She hopes to practice modern farming in the near future.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva de 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Elva consiste en la confección y venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella se encarga de diseñar sus propios modelos y ofrecerlos a la venta en su pequeño local hasta donde acude diariamente su fiel clientela quienes confían en ella ya que su paciencia y su pasión por cada uno de los detalles hace que su trabajo sea de calidad. En esta temporada de verano esta elaborando blusas variadas. Realiza este trabajo por 18 años y siempre lo ha hecho sola, además tiene habilidades para la elaboración de accesorios femeninos y con ello complementa su labor. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará hilos y telas para continuar con su trabajo de confección.
texts.en:
Elva is thirty-seven years old, is married, and has four children, all of whom live with her in the house that she owns.  Her work consists of making and selling clothing for women, men, and children.  She is in charge of designing her own models and offering them for sale in her small shop, where her loyal clientele find her daily.  Her customers trust that her patience and passion for every detail make her work high-quality.   

In this summer season, she is making different types of blouses.  She has worked in this trade for eighteen years, and she always works alone.  She has many skills in making feminine accessories, and this complements her work.  

In this opportunity, she will request 1000 soles.  She is very thankful to all of the people who make it possible for her to receive credit and to perform her work with the best results.  She promises once again to pay her installments on time.  

With the amount she has requested, she will buy thread and fabric in order to continue with her trade making clothing.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric wholesale for her work making clothing.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 34 years old and resides in Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer planting and harvesting corn as their main source of income.

To earn a living, Marilyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products.  She has been in business for more than 10 years.  She earns 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP in order to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. 

In 2011, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help her improve both her business and her living situation.  In the future, Marilyn wants to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase  canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BENKADI 1   est constitué  9  de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de   39  ans,  4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  KOLA  SOKORO, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur  5éme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le riz   est la spéculation cultivée par  ROKIA  la 2ème femme  debout  de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et de Bougouni, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 30 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
Benkadi 1 Group is made up of nine married women who average 39 years of age and 4 children. They all live in polygamous families in Kola Sokoro, a village in Bougouni, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fifth loan from the MFI. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

Rokia (second woman from right to left in the standing row) grows rice. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing in order to exploit 0.25 hectare.

After the harvest, the production will be sold in the village and in Bougouni, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

Rokia intends to turn an average profit of XOF 30'000 (ca US$ 60) per planting, which will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband cover the daily expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 2 est constitué  9  de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans,  5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  KOLA SOKORO, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 5éme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
L’arachide   est la spéculation cultivée par   CHATA       la1ère femme  assise     de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village  et  de Bougouni, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  120.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
Benkadi 2 Group is made up of nine married women who average 40 years of age and 5 children. They all live in polygamous families in Kola Sokoro, a village in Bougouni, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fifth loan from the MFI. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

Chata (first woman from left to right in the sitting row) grows peanuts. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing in order to exploit 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the production will be sold in the village and in Bougouni, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

Chata intends to turn an average profit of XOF 120'000 (ca US$ 240) per planting, which will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband cover the daily expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming business.

Welma has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling 'nipa' (woven palm frond mats for housing).

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Welma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams if building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 55-year-old lady from Nakuru and she is married with one child.

She keeps livestock, practicing zero grazing, and she has been in this business for the past three years.

Agnes has applied for her 2nd loan with KADET LTD which she intends to use for repairing the equipment she uses for chopping feed for her animals.

In the future, Agnes hopes is to be the leading zero-grazing farmer in her location.

loans.use: to repair her animal feed chopper

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 55 years old and comes from Nakuru. He is married and he has eight children aged 18, 16, 14, 12, 10, 8, 6 and 4 years old.

Samuel is a farmer who specializes in mixed farming, a business he has been doing for the past 23 years. He has applied for his first loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings, from KADET LTD which he intends to use for boosting his agricultural activities.

In the future, Samuel hopes to buy his own plot of land.

loans.use: To boost his farming activities. i.e., in mixed farming

loans.name: Wastaarabu Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two daughters who are in school. For three years now,Asha has been earning her living by running a beauty salon. She is doing fine. She works from 08 am to 10pm daily and is able to make a very good business return per month. From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request which she will use to buy missing beauty salon equipment. 

Asha dreams that one day will be able to expand her business by opening more branches with quality services. She will share this loan with her loan group" Wastaarabu" which consists of 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy missing beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sprockets, wheels, and gasoline for vehicle maintenance and pay for their transport business registration.

loans.name: Cristopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 28 years old and married to a farmer. 

He is a rice farmer. He has managed the farm for almost nine years with the help of his father, who introduced him to farming.

He would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and sacks of rice seed. 

Christopher hopes that someday he can build their own house to have a better living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and sacks of rice seed.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn lives in Molatuhan Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a driver and she manages their own retail store to earn a living. She has been doing this business for two years. 

Recently, she joined Gata Daku MPC and she requests a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase canned goods. spices and noodles for sale. She plans to save at least a small portion of her income for the future education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods. spices and noodles

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City with her family. She is married, having four children. 

To make a living, she owns and manages her cafeteria, selling food in town. She has been doing this for many years in order to support the needs of her children. 

She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy raw ingredients to cook. She is hopeful to see her business expand and to have better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKADI 3   est constitué   9 de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de     31    ans, 4  enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Kola Sokoro, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 5éme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
L’arachide   est la spéculation cultivée par   CHATA      la1ère femme debout      de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  BOUGOUNI , après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  170 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
This group called Benkadi 3   is made up of nine married women with an average age of 31 and four children, on average, all living in polygamous families in Kola Sokoro, one of the villages of  Bougouni, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their rainy season agricultural activities. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, the past loans having been correctly reimbursed. 

Peanuts are the crop cultivated by Chata, first woman standing left to right. With her loan, she intends to buy inputs and seeds and pay the plowing fees to cultivate 2 hectares. Her produce will be sold right in the village and in Bougouni, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 170,000 F CFA each growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay plowing fees for this growing season.

loans.name: Kwale Group

texts.en:
Mustapha, a member of Kwale group, is in her mid-30s and the mother of a boy and a girl, both of whom are in school. For 11 years now she has been a tailor designing a variety of clothes such as dresses, trousers, etc., and she also sells clothes-making materials. Working from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, she is able to make a very good profit per month.

This will be Mustapha's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania; she used the previous one to buy a tailoring machine and more clothing materials, and with the profit earned paid school fees and household expenses and reinvested in her enterprise. She will use this loan to buy more clothing materials, and dreams of opening a wholesale shop selling clothing materials.

Mustapha will share this loan with her loan group Kwale, which totals 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 47 years old and married and she supports a family of ten.  

She runs a cereals and horticulture trading business in Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last four years. She gets an average monthly income of KES 15,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET, which she plans to use to purchase ten bags of beans for resale. She anticipates profits that she will use to expand her business as well as to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to have her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase beans for resale.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine and her small family live in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region. She is 37 years old. She lives with her mother-in–law and two children. Her husband is working abroad in the Russian Federation. His financial support to his family from that work is not enough for them to keep minimum living conditions. This is the main reason that Marine became engaged in the clothes trading business. 

She sells women's and children's clothes at the Vanadzor wholesale market at a rented stall. All the clothes for sale she brings from Yerevan wholesale markets on a rented car. She has a lot of expenses and many family needs, but she manages perfectly and thinks about the purchase of a new collection of clothes.
 
So Marine asks a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to add to her summer season clothes collection, since the major part of it she has already sold.

loans.use: to add to her summer season clothes collection.

loans.name: Djiguisseme I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   DJIGUISSEME I   est constitué 8   de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 6  enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLA DIAGADA   , un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 3éme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
L’arachide   est la spéculation cultivée par   MASSIRA    1ére femme       debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  100 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur menage.
texts.en:
This group called  Djiguisseme I   is made up of eight married women with an average age of 48 and on average 6 children, all living in polygamous families in Kola Diagada, one of the villages of Bougouni, third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their rainy season agricultural activities. They are on their third loan with the institution, the past loans having been correctly reimbursed.

Peanuts are the crop cultivated by Massira, first woman standing in the photo, right to left. With her loan, she intends to buy inputs and seeds and pay the plowing fees to cultivate one hectare. Her produce will be sold right in the village, at the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women.


She expects to make a profit of 100,000 F CFA each growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay plowing fees for the agricultural season.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy is married and has one child. She is 29 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Mary Joy owns and operates her big sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 150,000 from her business. She has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 for additional capital, to buy more groceries to sell. Mary Joy has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Mary Joy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to add additional capital to her business and buy more groceries to sell and make better profits.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For the last thirteen years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of about KES 6,950 from the business. Kadzo was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan, of KES 20,000, to buy additional stock for her kiosk, such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions, to be sold to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children, and to continue expanding the business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she may improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for the kiosk where she sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem is 33 years old, married and a father of one child. 

For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

Shem was introduced to KADET Ltd. by our credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 to buy additional stock for his business such as dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on, to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his child as well as to expand his business. 

Shem's goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that he may provide his family with a good and stable life.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is 42 years old and a mother of two children. Both are currently studying in school. 

For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling goods and services from her general store in Malindi, where she earns a monthly profit of 6,500 KES. 

Maimuna was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and she is applying for her third loan of KES 25,000 to purchase additional stock needed for her business. She will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees, purchase food for the family and expand the current business. 

Maimuna hopes to own her own supermarket in future so as to help improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock needed for her business.

loans.name: Khalid Javaid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 45-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, along with his family. He is the father of seven children. Three of them go to school and one of his sons helps him in cattle farming.  

He is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He raises cattle in his yard at home and sells them at a local market. He has to feed each calf till it is one or two years old and is grown up and healthy, which is a very lengthy and expensive procedure. Fetal diseases are the major challenge for him.

A few days ago, his one healthy cow died due to fetal disease. He has been increasing the cattle through breeding from that cow, but now his breeding procedure has ended badly.

Khalid wants to buy a cow to keep constant the breeding procedure but he already invested his all savings into his current cattle farm. He does not have a sufficient amount to buy a cow for breeding. 

Our field partner met with him and let him know about all the terms and condition of Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. He agreed with our repayment schedule and signed happily all the necessary documents.
 
He hopes that he will pay all the installments on time. With the profit, he will buy fodder for the cattle and care for them against diseases.
