Khalid is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 21 years old married with one child. 

For the past three years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of KES 6,900. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer and is applying for his second loan, in the amount of KES 35,000. He is going to use a portion of the loan to service and repair his motorbike and use the remaining amount to put up a fruit and vegetable kiosk for his wife to run. 

He will use the profits to pay school fees for his child as well as invest back into his businesses. His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses, so that he will improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: To repair and service his motorcycle and set up a food kiosk for his wife.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a thirty-two-year-old man, married to Jane and a father of three children. He operates a motorcycle transport business and has been in business for six years, getting a monthly income of eighteen thousand shillings.

This will be Josphat’s second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. 

In future Josphat wishes to expand his business and become successful.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the motorcycle

loans.name: Kadhengi

texts.en:
Kadhengi is asking for a loan from Kiva to buy domestic animals. He has had previous loans with Milango, with some of the loans being listed on the Kiva website. 

He has charcoal business that is currently running and he asks for another loan to buy and sell domestic animals. His long-term goal is open up a retail shop. The challenge he faces is financing his ideas. 

He heard of Milango through friends and he decided to join. The extra income that is raised from the loan will improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy domestic animals.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Analyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to pay the laborers' salaries and buy fertilizers.

Analyn has been farming sugarcane for three years and also earns additional income from food vending and motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay the laborers' salaries and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle, which is used in his transport business.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: Pius lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya. He is 39 years old, married, and blessed with two children. He has been in the business of selling new clothes for more than ten years. He started the business with contributions from his family members. He learned about Milango through an employee. He decided to join so that he could access credit to fund his venture. He is applying for a loan to buy ten pairs of men’s denim trousers, 20 shirts, and shoes, to sell. The challenges that he faces in the business are price instability and inflation that cuts down his income at times. He has ambitions of having a big boutique in his home town of Kaloleni in future. The extra income will go to his savings. He will also pay school fees for his children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy ten pairs of men’s denim trousers, 20 shirts, and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts and replace the sidecar of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheels, spare parts and gasoline needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Recho

texts.en:
Recho is 59 years old and married. She is into the milk-trade business in Chepngetuny, a location served by KADET's Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the last seven years; she gets an average monthly income of 11,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

Recho plans to use part of the amount borrowed of 60,000 KES to purchase more milk for resale and the remaining amount to pay her children's school fees. Her dream is to open a retail shop in Kapsabet town.

loans.use: To purchase more milk for resale and pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Grupo Luku Group

texts.en: Florinda is one the members of the Luku Group.  The word "Florinda" means" Hope" in the local language. She is taking out the loan to add to her working capital and buy some additional supplies, such as kale and cabbage. She is a hardworking woman. She started her business in 2004 with her own working capital of $70. She is happy with the loan because TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy kale and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She sells local dresses that are known as “lesos” by the locals. She has been in this business for five years now, and she sees every possibility of the business growing to the next level. She also owns some rental houses and she gets income from them. 

She is 32 years of age, married and blessed with three children. She knew Milango through a friend and now seeks a loan to buy 50 pieces of traditional “lesos.” The extra income that she raises from the loan will help her pay school fees for her children and improve the living standards of her family. The challenges that she faces in the business are competition and financing. These are the challenges that she fights every day in doing this business.

loans.use: to buy 50 pieces of traditional "lesos” (local dresses).

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely, 58 years old, is married and blessed with six children. She owns and manages a beauty parlor in the village of Minante 2. With this business, she earns a net income of PHP 200 a day. Due to her lack of capital, she decided to request a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy materials needed in her beauty parlor, such as a foot spa set, shampoo, conditioners, hair dye, hot oil, and hair-straightening equipment. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can be able to significantly improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in her beauty parlor, such as a foot spa set, shampoo, conditioners, hair dye, hot oil, and hair-straightening equipment.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, 40 years old, is from Ol'kalou. He is married and has three children, 12, 9 and 7 years old. His wife Asenath assists him with farm work. He is a farmer and also operates an Agrovet (animal healthcare) shop. He has operated this business for the past two years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd, and he plans to use it to buy more stock for his Agrovet business. In the future, he hopes to enlarge his business, to buy a plot of land, and to educate his children.

loans.use: to add stock to his animal healthcare business.

loans.name: Delmus

texts.en:
Delmus is 26 years old, and he operates an electrical repair shop in Malindi town. He has been in the business for the last four years. He earns a monthly profit of 6,800 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

Delmus was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES. He intends to use the loan to add tools and spare parts needed for his business. He will save the anticipated profit and help take care of his niece. In future, Delmus hopes to grow his electrical repair shop so as to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools and spare parts needed for his business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila, 47 years old, is married and blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a motorcycle transport for almost 26 years. 

Leonila has four motorcycles, and she's earning a net income of Php 660 per day on this business. Leonila wants an added capital on it, so that she decided to request a loan of Php 20,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycles. 

She's happy because she's earning a lot of income with this business.  She's hoping her loan will be granted so that she can develop her transportation business more.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycles

loans.name: Nicole Frances

texts.en: Nicole Frances is a young entrepreneur in Oroquieta City. She  has been running her general store for five years to earn a living. She is a new member of Gata Daku MPC and she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy rice and feeds for sale. She plans to expand her business to generate more income and save a portion of her revenue to improve her general living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice and feeds for sale

loans.name: Tehmina

texts.en:
Tehmina is 38 years old. She lives with her children in Vanadzor city. She has been engaged in a women's clothes trading business for seven years, and she mainly trades blouses, sweaters, dresses, tracksuits and jackets. She is already skilled in this field, and she earns a decent profit in her trading business. 

Her husband is in the Russian Federation for work abroad, and sometimes he also supports his family financially, but his wife’s business is a great help for him. Tehmina has already once taken a loan from Kiva lenders, and she has managed to renew her spring clothes’ collection. 

This time, she has decided to rely on Kiva lenders’ support, and by the help of the new loan that she wants to ask for, she will buy a summer season clothes collection.

loans.use: to buy a summer season clothes collection to diversify her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Grupo Lopo Out Group

texts.en:
Angelina is one the members from Lopo Out Group and the word "Angelina" is in a local language and means "Hope."

She is taking the loan to add more to her own working capital in order to buy some additional supplies such as thread and  sewing needles. She is a hard-working woman; she started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $40 dollars.

loans.use: to buy thread and  sewing needles

loans.name: Mnarani Group

texts.en:
Musa, who is in his early 20s, is single. For three years now, he has been supporting himself by having a carpentry business. He works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month. This will be Musa's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which repaid successfully, he managed to buy a carpentry machine and more wood. With business return received, he covered his home expenses, reinvested back into his business, and saved the remaining amount. 

Musa will use this loan to replenish his stock of wood. He dreams of improving his business by having modern carpentry equipment so as to obtain more customers.

He will share this loan with his loan group " Mnarani " which totals 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his stock of wood.

loans.name: Arshavir

texts.en: Arshavir is 33 years old, and his is already a skilled and very famous professional photographer in Yerevan. Arshavir is married, and he has two small sons. For several years, Arshavir worked as a driver, but one day he became greatly interested in recording and photography. After buying a professional photo and video camera, he became seriously engaged in this work. He took special courses on recording, and on taking and mounting photos, over the course of several months. Today Arshavir is a highly recommended photographer whose services are much in demand. He is invited to take videos and still photos of marriage parties, christening parties, birthdays and corporate parties, and to have some photo-shoots. He says that his work is very pleasing and colorful. He enjoys viewing from the sidelines how happy people become on their marriage day and their birthdays, and he helps them prolong their happiness and those cheerful memories on photos and in video for a very long time. Arshavir is applying for a loan, since he needs a car of his own so he can take his special equipment with him every time.

loans.use: to buy his own car, so he can take his special photography equipment with him to jobs.

loans.name: Ledi

texts.en: Ledi is a 24-year-old man and the married father of a 1-year-old son, who resides in a central city. Four years ago, he opened up a mechanic’s shop, in an effort to make an income for his family. “I guess I was way too young then, and inexperienced, and that reflected on my work. Yet, being talented and determined made me look ahead and hope. The income I have been making hasn’t been that much, but it has been enough that I cannot complain. When I heard from the loan officers of VisionFund Albania that they were offering a startup loan in collaboration with Kiva with lower interest rates and administrative fees, I wanted to take advantage of it. So I did, and here I am now, needing the lenders’ financial help to add a new activity to my existing one, that of auto-repairing. I would very much appreciate their help,” is what Ledi said to the loan officer during his interview.

loans.use: to buy neccessary equipment for his new auto-service shop.

loans.name: Fatime

texts.en:
Fatime, a hardworking villager lady, is applying for a loan for the first time.

Here it is what Fatime said during her interview with the loan officer: “I grew up in a different era when loans never existed and the fact that I was never blessed with children so that I could learn from them, kept me ignorant completely, I guess. I always tried to spend as much as I had. Cash in and out. That was it. But I also had this desire to make more, though, because the income I was generating from the livestock type of thing was something, but not really enough for me and my husband. So, when I heard of such loans from the staff of VisionFund Albania explaining it in details, I gave it a thought and I called them back for some more clarifications. And here we are together today discussing to finalize my request about this loan."

Fatime wants to add another dairy cow to increase her income.

loans.use: To add one more dairy cow so that she generates an income for her and her husband.

loans.name: Naataesim

texts.en:
Naataesim is 74 years old, and married to three wives with 20 children. He has been in the agriculture business for the last ten years, with a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Naataesim has managed to get a second loan from KADET LIMITED for KES 30,000, which he used to purchase more fertilizer.

The anticipated profits will be used to buy more goats for his business. 

Naataesim's hope and dream is to be a successful and helpful man to his community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of his motorcyle transport

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is married with 3 children; he is 53 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Ramon owns and operates his big store to earn a living, and had this business for 12 years. Each month, he earns 20,000 doing this type of business. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000 for additional capital to buy more groceries.

Ramon has been a member of PMPC for two years. 

In the future, Ramon hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: for additional capital to buy more groceries to sell to gain a higher profit

loans.name: Hazina

texts.en:
Hazina is 61 years old, married, and a mother of seven children. She owns a motorcycle and, for the past three years, it has earned her a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town. Hazina earns a monthly profit of KES 4,300. 

She was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and she is applying for her first loan, in the amount of KES 15,000. She is going to use the loan to service and repair her motorbike. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her last-born child, who is still in school, as well as to reinvest in her business. 

Hazina's goal for the future is to continue growing her business, so that she would help improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to repair and service her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is married, with two children. He is 61 years old and lives in Masabud, Clarin, Philippines.

Rudy is a farmer, growing fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for one year. He has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer for his garden.

Rudy has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. In the future, Rudy hopes to save money for his family's consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for his garden.

loans.name: Mayis

texts.en:
Mayis, 49 years old, lives in the city of Vanadzor, located in the Lory region. He lives with his wife and a son; his daughter is already married and lives separately with her family.

Mayis has been a shoemaker for eight years, working in a small booth near their building. He repairs shoes, and all of his clients are very satisfied with his fast and accurate work. He is now requesting a 250.000 AMD loan to buy raw materials (leather, soles, etc.) for his work, and he also intends to start making shoes and selling them right from his booth.

Mayis hopes very much that Kiva lenders will appreciate his efforts and help him to realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his business and to start making shoes to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKADI III    est constitué de 7 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans,  3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  KOLA DIAGADA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 3éme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
L’arachide   est la spéculation cultivée par  AWA    la 2ème femme debout      de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  125 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur menage.
texts.en:
The Benkadi III group is composed of seven married women averaging 32 years of age, with three children. They also live in polygamous families in Kola Diagada, a village in Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, having duly repaid prior loans. Awa, the second one standing from the left, grows peanuts. With her loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] and seeds and pay for the cost of labor to work 2 ha [about 5 acres].

After harvesting, the produce will be sold at the village marked, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve a revenue of 125,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. This revenue will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with everyday household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural inputs and the cost of labor for one agricultural cycle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 61 years old, from Olkalou. He is married to Jane, who is a housewife and they have three children, aged 20, 16, and 13 years.

Joseph is a farmer and he has been in this occupation for the past ten years. He has applied for his sixth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), in the amount of KES 45,000, and his plan is to use it to buy farm inputs, like seeds and fertilizer.

Joseph's hope and dream for his business and family is to have well-distinguished farm produce/outputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the premises and stock his store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a dried fish business in the Philippines.

Esther requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish for her business.

Esther has been in this business for 11 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is married, with three children. She is 33 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Lea owns and operates her sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 for additional capital to buy more groceries to sell.

Lea has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. In the future, Lea hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more groceries to sell/retail.

loans.name: Abel Apolinario

texts.es:
Abel es un joven de 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica y día a dia se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, trabajo con el cual puede apoyar a su familia a solventar los gastos del hogar, sobre todo porque tiene hermanos pequeños.

Abel está muy feliz y agradecido por el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder construir un cerco en su vivienda, ya que con ello podrá dar mayor seguridad para sus familiares y seguir trabajando para podrá hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de taxis”.
texts.en:
Abel is a young man aged 26, he lives in the city of Ica and every day he puts a lot of effort into improving his situation. This is why he works as a motorcycle taxi driver. With this job he can help his family with the household expenses, since he has young siblings.

Abel is very happy and grateful for the support of the Kiva lenders, since their help allows him to buy construction supplies for building a fence around his home. This way he will be able to offer his family more security and continue working in order to realize his dream: "To own a taxi company".

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 27 years old and married to Viola and they are expecting their first child. Josphat hawks green tea leaves in Kipsigak location and is served by KADET LTD Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for the last three years. From this business he gets a monthly income of KES. 8,000.

Josphat has borrowed a loan of KES. 15,000 which he will use to purchase more green tea leaves for resale. He will use part of the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children and the remaining amount to repay his loan.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widow aged 44 years old, also a mother of three children whom she supports.  She owns a hardware shop in Koibatek area and has been in the business for a period of two years earning an average income of KES 40,000.

She is now servicing her third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use the amount to purchase more stock for her hardware shop.  The anticipated profit from the business will be used to repay the loan. 

Her dream is become a successful business lady as she lives a contented life.

loans.use: To purchase more  stock for her hardware store

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 39-year-old charcoal dealer in Majaoni, Mombasa. He is a married man who supports four children and one wife. He has been in this business for the last four years and has done great.

This marks his fourth borrowing from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), to finance his business. He will use the requested loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale and the anticipated profit to service his loan and also a motor-bicycle for transportation business. 

He hopes to have a successful life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoals for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 28 años, es una joven mujer trabajadora, es madre de 2 hijas a quienes cuida junto a su esposo en su casa propia. María se dedica a la venta de pollos. Tiene un puesto de ventas en uno de los mercados mas concurridos por la población, afortunadamente tiene buenas ventas y considerables ganancias económicas ya que su lugar de trabajo esta muy bien ubicado en una esquina visible, pero este trabajo tiene mucho sacrificio ya que para conseguir los buenos y frescos productos que ofrece a sus clientes tiene que madrugar hasta los centros de abastos de pollos para adelantarse a otros vendedores que compiten en este mismo sector. Ella sabe que todo su esfuerzo vale la pena y es recompensado al ver que sus pequeñas hijas tienen todo lo necesario para estar tranquilas. Le gusta la libertad que le brinda este negocio ya que puede divertirse por las tardes jugando y practicando algún deporte, además de estar cerca a su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará pollos vivos de buen peso y tamaño para continuar desarrollando su trabajo.
texts.en: María is 28 years old, a young, hard working woman, and mother of two daughters who she raises with her husband, in their own home. María makes money by selling chickens. She has a stand in one of the more visited markets in town and, fortunately, thanks to good sales and considerable earnings, her stand is located in an easily seen corner, but her job requires a lot of sacrifice, because in order to get the best and freshest products, she needs to wake up early and go to distribution centers to get the chickens and be sure to get there before other vendors that compete in the same sector. She knows that all her hard work is worth it and views her compensation as her daughters being able to have all they need in order to be happy. She likes the freedom that comes with running her own business and that she can spend the afternoons having fun playing a sport and also being close to her family. She is taking this opportunity to ask for a loan of 200 dollars and is thankful for the financial support she is receiving in order to be successful, she also promises to be punctual in paying back her loan. With the money, she will purchase more live chickens of a good size and weight so she can continue developing her business.

loans.use: purchase chickens on wholesale.

loans.name: Mercedes Beatriz

texts.es:
La ciudad de Santo Domingo es un punto clave en el Ecuador para las actividades de comercio, pues es el puerto principal en donde se encuentra la frontera entre las Regiones Sierra y Costa del país, este referente ha aportado para el crecimiento de sus zonas rurales y urbanas y razón por la cual muchos emprendedores y microempresarios se han dado a conocer con sus productos.
Mercedes es una mujer emprendedora que gracias a una cadena de comercialización de medicina natural, descubrió el potencial que había en ella. 
Mercedes vende estos productos útiles como complemento alimenticio, cosméticos, estéticos, nutricionales y lo hace de forma ambulante visitando a sus clientes que ya son fijos y que además son referidos de otros.
Mercedes tomó la decisión de asumir este reto para colaborar con su esposo para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella está casada con David Fernando que trabaja como taxista y con quien tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 5 años, ella tuvo que dejar de trabajar por mucho tiempo debido al embarazo de riesgo que tuvo con su segunda hija y esto causó que en el hogar se genere cierto decaimiento económico y es hasta hace 2 años que ella retomó la actividad volviendo a llamar a sus clientes y manteniendo stock de productos en su casa para poder atender las necesidades de clientes que le buscaban. 
El préstamo que ella está solicitando es para poder adquirir los nuevos productos que la cadena ofrece y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes los productos y sus beneficios. Ésta es la forma con el que Mercedes espera incrementar sus ingresos para aportar en su hogar y así todos obtener un mejor estilo de vida y además poco a poco llegar a cumplir su sueño de dirigir una red de promotoras de este producto y poder ser parte del crecimiento profesional y laboral de muchas mujeres.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo is a important point for commercial activity in Ecuador as it is the principal doorway located on the border of the mountain and coastal regions of the country.  This fact has contributed to the growth of the rural and urban zones of the area and the reason many entrepreneurs and micro-businesses have a presence here.

Mercedes is an enterprising woman, who thanks to a marketing chain of natural medicine, discovered the potential that was in her. Mercedes sells these practical products as dietary supplements, cosmetics, aesthetics and nutritional additives. She does this by going and visiting her clients who now are regular customers, many on recommendation of others. 

Mercedes made the decision to assume this challenge to help her husband meet the household expenses. She is married to David Fernando who is a taxi driver. They have two children, aged 4 and 5. She had to stop working for a long time because of a difficult pregnancy with her second child. This caused a certain lowering of the family's living standard. So two years ago she took up her business again, calling on her customers and restocking product in her house in order to meet the needs of her clients.

The loan she is requesting is to buy new products that the chain is offering so she can provide them and their benefits to her customers. In this way Mercedes hopes to increase her income and reach a higher standard of living. And little by little attain her dream of heading a network of sellers of this product and assist the professional growth of many women.

loans.use: to buy new products wholesale.

loans.name: Carmenza Benita

texts.es: Doña Carmenza es originaria de la ciudad de León. Tiene 47 años de edad, madre soltera de 5 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas.  Ella empezó haciendo  cajeta las cuales vendía de forma ambulante, posteriormente con mucho esfuerzo logro poner su distribuidora de piñatas, las cuales distribuye en el mercado. Sus expectativas son obtener  mejores ingresos y lograr  hacer  su empresa. Solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima tales como: Cartón, pega, almidón, mecate, tijeras y papel crepe. Su meta futuro es entregar más productos de mejor calidad y expandir su negocio a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
Carmenza was born in the city of León. She is 47 and the single mother of five children. She is a merchant who makes and sells piñatas. Her first business was selling cajeta, milk-based caramel, as a street vendor. Then she worked hard to become a piñata dealer to local markets. 

She expects to increase her income and grow her business. She has applied for a loan to buy supplies such as cardboard, glue, starch, twine, scissors, and crepe paper. Her goal is to make higher quality products to sell throughout the country.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as cardboard, glue, starch, twine, scissors, and crepe paper.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. She has had some formal education as she is a junior high school graduate.For close to two years now Elizabeth has prepared and sold gari, a traditional Ghanaian snack made from starched, powdered cassava. She sells in Amanfro, located near Cape Coast. She is applying for a  loan to buy additional cassava, which will allow her to meet rising customer demand. Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She hopes to use any additional profits from her sales to develop her business further and ensure that all of her children receive an education.

loans.use: to buy additional cassava

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Even though Gertrude grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Gertrude is an entrepreneur. She sells processed fish in Dafonu (near Hohoe). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 11 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their eight children. Gertrude has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her product and also she wanted to acquire formal education; hence she decide to take a loan. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more processed fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gertrude wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty and also to enable her to continue to pay her own school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more processed fish to sell

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 44 years old and lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Oretha did not go school, and she has three children between 26 and 18 years old. Only two are presently attending school. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She started her business with a little money from her mother which she managed to turn to more money. For three years she has been running a table where she sells rice and palm oil. She  spends 9 hours on her business, A problem she faces is insufficient income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 27-year-old man from Chepkumia Junction, a location found in Vihiga county which is located in Kakamega, Kenya. He supports three people in his family and is married to Irene, who is a business lady. He has two kids who are seven years old and the last born is one year old.

He has a retail shop within his location. He has been doing this business for the last six years with the help of KADET's loans. He has been acquiring loans which normally help him run the business. This time around, he has asked for his fourth loan which he will use to purchase more stock for expansion, hence enabling him to generate more income so as to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profit to venture into agriculture production.

His dream is to attain maximum profit to enable his family to live a comfortable life and be educated and have knowledge in all aspects.

loans.use: to expand his retail shop

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo is 43 years old and is married. They live in a rural community and make their living from farming. He operates his motorcycle as a transport business to earn income. Together with his wife, they dream that their family will someday become successful and financially stable in the future. To make their dream turn into reality, Romeo is patiently supported by his wife in operating his transport business. To keep his motorcycle in good condition, he is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 to buy tires, sprockets, bearings and other spare parts needed for the vehicle's maintenance.

loans.use: to buy tires, sprockets, bearings and other spare parts needed for the vehicle's maintenance.

loans.name: Alejandra Del Carmen

texts.es: Alejandra, a sus 40 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas. Desde que era niña ha vivido en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias y actualmente posee cultivos de café y tiene cerdos de levante los cuales cría para luego venderlos en el mercado, junto con la cosecha del café, además alterna su actividad agrícola con la atención de una pequeña tienda de abarrotes de su propiedad; con esto ha logrado obtener ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Alejandra es una señora emprendedora, dedicada y siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan avanzar; por esta razón solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de lechones para levante (cría de cerdos recién nacidos) y comprar surtido (productos lácteos, galletería, granos, confitería, productos de aseo) para la tienda, así podrá tener más disponibilidad de animales para la venta y podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos en su tienda, lo que le permitirá mejorar los ingresos del grupo familiar y, en un futuro cercano tendrá la posibilidad de aprovechar completamente los recursos que posee en la finca, ampliando sus cultivos y comprando más cerdos, esto daría como resultado el cumplimiento del principal sueño de Alejandra.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 40, lives with her husband and three daughters. She was raised in the country, where she learned to farm. She now has coffee plants and raises piglets to sell in the market, along with her coffee harvest. She also has a small grocery store on her property, which has provided income to support her household.

Alejandra is enterprising and dedicated and is always looking for ways to be successful. She has applied for a loan to buy piglets to raise and to buy milk products, cookies, grains, sweets, and cleaning products for her store. She will have more animals to sell and more inventory in her store, which will increase her household income. She hopes to soon take full advantage of her farm resources by increasing her crops and buying more pigs, thereby realizing her most important dream.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and to buy milk products, cookies, grains, sweets, and cleaning products for her store.

loans.name: Vimbainashe Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 37-year-old Codrio from Mutare. Codrio is a member of a group called Vimbainashe Group. She is a single parent with two children, both of whom attend school. She also cares for two other dependents. Codrio runs a clothing business selling winter shoes, blankets and jerseys. The business has been in operation for nine years. She says the main challenges she faces are high import duty at border posts and high transportation costs. Codrio has requested a loan of 600 USD to buy more blankets and jerseys for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family. In the future Codrio plans to own a boutique shop in town.	

NB. Roniah is also a member of the group and is holding her child.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and jerseys for resale during this winter season

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma lives in the Gongoni area, a 30-minute drive north of Malindi, Kenya. The area in a bit dry and it is known for the manufacture of salt. Iron sheets in this area corrode and tear due to corrosion. Most people are employed to work in the salt factory here. Fatuma sells charcoal and firewood to the residents of the area. She has been doing this for a while. She learned of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy extra bags of charcoal and firewood to sell  She wants her business to grow and to be able to serve the whole market. The major challenge that she faces in doing this business is high transportation costs. She has five children who attend school.

loans.use: to buy extra bags of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya. She is a wife and a mother of six children.  Her main business is selling petrol. She started the business from the savings that she made through selling fruits. She has ambitions of opening more branches of his business. She seeks a loan to buy jericans and 100 litres of petrol for resale. The main challenges facing the business are price instabilities and high fuel transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy jericans and 100 litres of petrol.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is 35 years old and married with three children between the ages of 3 years and 10 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business in order to survive. 

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells fish within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well because she has been able to take care of her family out of the profit she made.

Mabinty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to become a fish agent. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu is 35 years old and married with two children ages 8 years and 17 years. She runs a domestic product in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. Her children are going to school.

She's been in this business since 2005 and sells a variety of food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem with her business is its improper location.

Abibatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plates and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plates and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 40 years old and married with three children between 3 years and 12 years old. She runs a palm oil business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells palm oil within her environment.  She says that the main problem for her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional inventory (kerosene, cooking oil, flour, etc.)

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet Zainab, she is is in her early thirties, and from Tombo area western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 15. Her children are currently attending school.  

Zainab has a clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create an income for her daily bread. She works at the business ten hours per day, seven days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of capital to run her business.

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy more sets of pans and clothing. She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business. 

In the future; Zainab plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more sets of pans and clothing.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Isata, who is in her early forties; she is from Tombo, in the western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married to a fisherman, and blessed with two children, ages 12  and 18.  Her children are going to school. 

Isata runs a food stand business at home; she sells rice, tomato paste, and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Isatu says the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient financing to expand her business.

Isata has requested a loan to buy more cooking items like rice, tomato paste and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, tomato paste and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 39 years old, married to Mary, and blessed with five children, aged 11, 9, 7, 4 and 2 years respectively. He owns a boutique, a business he started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of about KES 25,000. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 60,000 to purchase two sewing machines and rolls of clothing materials. The profit he earns will aid him in expanding this business as well as pay school fees for his children. He dreams of buying land and building rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines and rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 32-year-old builder in Mishomuhoroni, Mombasa. He is a married man whose spouse provides additional income, and together they support two people.

Martin has been in the construction business for the last one and a half years, and testifies that it's a great venture.

This marks Martin's third borrowing from KADET Ltd, to purchase a hammer, wheelbarrow, spade, cement and sand for his work. He will use the income to service his loan and to put up a retail shop business for his family.

Martin hopes to succeed in life and see his family succeed as well.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools and materials.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 28 years old, from Nakuru, and he is married with three children, aged 7, 4 and 1 year. He is a motorcycle operator, a business he has been in for the past three years. 

Anthony has applied for his third loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), which he intends to use to buy a motorcycle.

His hope for the future is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    est constitué  de  10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de   33   ans,  4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  M’PIAKALA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 9eme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
L’arachide   est la spéculation cultivée par    KOROTOUMOU  la 1ere femme debout  dela gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à BOUGOUNI, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
This group is composed of ten married women, who average 33 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in M’PIAKALA, a village in BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their rainy season farm work. They are on their ninth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

Peanuts is the crop grown by KOROTOUMOU, who is the first woman standing from the left. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in villages and in BOUGOUNI. She plans on making a profit of 100,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will enable her to pay back the loan and help her husband to cover the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and plowing for planting crops

loans.name: Praise Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 52-year-old Ellen from Mutare. She is a single parent with four children. Ellen is the leader in the group called Praise Group. She also cares for three other dependents. 

Ellen runs a clothing business selling kids' wear, ladies' wear and cosmetics. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges faced are delayed payments from customers and high import duties. 

Ellen has requested a loan of $400 to purchase clothes (kids' wear and ladies' wear) to sell to farm workers in Manicaland. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. In the future Ellen plans to buy a residential plot for the family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to supply to farm workers in Manicaland.

loans.name: Choko

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Choko from Liberia. She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. The area is one of the most populous areas in Montserrado County, with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. Choko is single and has three children, ages 15, 13, and 11. Her children are currently attending school and live at home. She runs a business selling used clothes, such as blouses, tee-shirts and trousers from a table. She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business two years ago, using money given to her by her mother. Typically, she works at her business from 7 AM to 4 PM, from Monday to Saturday, and she transports her goods to her business by bus. She cites her greatest challenge as being her small capital. She is proud of her business because it supports her home. Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to buy more used clothes, such as blouses, tee-shirts and trousers, for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house and educate her children. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes, such as blouses, tee-shirts and trousers, for her business.

loans.name: Tetee

texts.en: 40-year-old Tetee operates a table where she sells food, including cassava and bananas, in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populous areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county, with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. She is unmarried and has six children, between 12 and 25. Only two are currently attending school, and four of them live at home. She cannot read or write, but she is good at managing her business. She describes herself as a good businesswoman. Tetee has had a table business for the past seven years. She works 10 hours, six days in a week, at her business. Her greatest challenge is her small income. She intends to use the loan to buy more foodstuffs, including cassava and bananas, for her business. She started her business with help from her fiancé, who sells charcoal. She likes her business because it helps her buy items in the home. In the future, she wants to own a house.  She wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs, including cassava and bananas, for her business.

loans.name: Aima Fil

texts.en:
Aima Fil is 30 years old and married with one child. They live in Clarin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) and she manages their own vulcanizing shop to earn a living. She has just started the business. 

She became a member of Gata Daku MPC this year and is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy tools, tires and accessories to be used in the business. She is hopeful that in the near future their general living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy tools, tires and accessories.

loans.name: Utkir

texts.ru:
Уткиру 34 года. Он спокойный и трудолюбивый человек, проживает в селе района Кубадиён. Он женат и имеет четверых детей, которых необходимо обеспечивать. Уткир занимается выращиваем сельскохозяйственной культуры на 0,08 га участке земли. В его домашнем хозяйстве есть две коровы и один бык для нужды семьи. 
Чтобы улучшить финансовое положение семьи Уткир собирается заняться  животноводческим бизнесом, а именно купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. У него имеется большой сарай для содержания скота, а также стартовый капитал в размере 2000 сомони (TJS). Уткир просит кредит для закупа 5 голов коров и телят и их корма. Он будет заниматься этим бизнесом вместе с женой. 
Благодаря кредиту у Уткира будет дополнительный доход, часть которой он будет тратить на продвижения бизнеса, а часть откладывать на образование детей.
texts.en: Utkir is 34 years old.  He is calm and hardworking person, living in a village of the Quabadiyon district.  He is married and has four children whom he needs to support.  Utkir is involved in growing agricultural crops on 0.08 hectares of land.  His farm also contains two cows and one bull to meet the needs of the family.  Utkir is planning to get involved in an animal husbandry business, specifically in buying and selling cattle, in order to improve the family's financial situation.  He has a large barn for keeping livestock and also a starting capital of 2000 somoni (TJS).  Utkir is requesting this loan to buy five cows and calves and feed for them.  He will be running this business together with his wife.  Thanks to the loan, Utkir will have additional income, a part of which he will spend on advancing his business and part on savings for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy five cows and calves and livestock feed in order to start a family animal husbandry business

loans.name: Jodel

texts.en:
Jodel lives in Simanu. He is married and has two children. For the past eight years he has been farming, and his family relies on this for a living.  He is asking to borrow a loan in order to finance his farming needs with the supply of fertilizers and seeds to grow. 

Any extra income that he makes from farm labor work will go towards his family's daily necessities and a little savings. Jodel dreams to start a separate business of landscaping, but he has difficulties in finding customers so he set this aside for the meantime and focuses on farming.

loans.use: to finance his farming needs with the supply of fertilizers and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia, 31 years of age, is married to a private employee and blessed with two children. She owns and has managed businesses of selling eggs and a variety store for almost 9 years. With this business she's earning a net income of about Php 10,000 a month. Rosalia also sells some condiments, cooking oil, and dried fish to have an additional source of income. 

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to avail a loan amounting to Php 50,000 to purchase fifteen dozen quail and chicken eggs to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business to become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fifteen dozen quail and chicken eggs to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKADI II    est constitué 10   de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans,  5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à M’PIAKALA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 9 eme  prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Le l’arachide et le mil sont les  spéculations cultivées par MAH   1ère  femme       debout de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  0,5hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de   50000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur menage.
texts.en:
The group "BENKADI II" is composed of ten married women averaging 32 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in M’PIAKALA, a village in BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their rainy season farm work. They are on their ninth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

Peanuts and millet are the crops grown by MAH, who is the first woman standing from the left. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in villages and at markets. She plans on making a profit of 500,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will enable her to pay back the loan and help her husband to cover the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and plowing for planting crops

loans.name: Golden

texts.en:
50-year-old Golden, continues to grow his Zoona Mobile money transfers business thanks to the opportunity he has to access working capital through Kiva. He has been running the business for 4 years now and is a father of 4 and has 1 grandchild.

This is Golden’s third Kiva loan, he used his first loan to buy a new computer and increase his working capital float for his shop in Mansa.  He used the second loan to open two new outlets in the towns of Kashikishi and Kawambwa. These two locations are now opened and transacting but are not yet profitable.  Today Golden continues in his quest to have more mobile money transfer outlets opened. He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him finance opening another shop.  

Golden's Kiva loan will serves as start-up capital for his micro-business. He will be able to purchase a trading booth, two new phones, and employ one person to do the day-to-day transactions at his new business.

Golden would like to take this opportunity to thank his lenders for their support. He is grateful for this opportunity and hopeful that he will continue to grow the business.

loans.use: To grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business by providing funds to start a new outlet, including buying a trading booth, new phone, and employing a teller

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi is 63 years old, married, and a mother of three children. For the last twelve years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her grocery store in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of about KES 5,000. Kavumbi was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for her third loan of KES 15,000 to buy additional stock for her grocery store, such as cooking oil, vegetables, fruits, cooking flour and so on, to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as to expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her grocery store so that she may help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is married and a 19 year old mother of one child. Her husband is a fishermen and she helps him augment their living with her nipa making business, selling it in the community of Sapang Dalaga. She has been in this business for more than two years. She took out a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy more raw material like nipa leaves and knot. She plan to expand her business to have a better living condition of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more raw material like nipa leaves and knot

loans.name: Juana Alicia

texts.es:
Juana tiene 48 años de edad, es divorciada, madre soltera de dos hijas (23 y 15 años) la mayor esta por graduarse de la universidad y la menor estudia el nivel básico en la escuela donde reside. 
Desde muy pequeña ella se dedico a los oficios domésticos de la familia y luego se caso y se separo ya que su esposo emigro hacia los estados unidos, ella siguió luchando y puso un negocio de venta de tortillas en la comunidad, vendía todos los días, tenia que moler dos quintales de maíz a la semana para vender las tortillas, luego con el tiempo trabajo cuidando y limpiando casas en el municipio, trabajo que siempre realiza.

Con esfuerzos ella ha ayudado a sus hijas en los estudios, se ha tenido que sacrificar cada día para apoyar a sus hijas en el estudio. Con sus ahorros producto del trabajo, ahora esta construyendo una casa de ladrillo, para darle a sus hijas una mejor comodidad.

la señora solicita un crédito a la fundación Campo, para comprar 126 bolsas de cemento y el resto para pagarle a los mosos que trabajaran en el llenado del plafon serán 28 trabajadores a $12.00  y el resto para otros gastos. Ella ya cuenta con la arena, el hierro y otros materiales para la construcción.

con el crédito, llenara el flafon de la casa que esta en construcción. y terminara las partes mas importantes de la casa, tendrá una vivienda mas digna donde vivir con sus hijas y mas cómodas.

su deseo y su lucha cada día es para ver a sus hijas profesionales y que puedan desarrollarse en el ámbito profesional con sus carreras universitarias. Ademas ,en el futuro sueña con construir un segundo nivel de la casa en construcción.
texts.en:
Juana is 48, divorced, and the single mother of two children, ages 23 and 15. The oldest is about to graduate from college and the youngest attends a local school. From a young age, Juana has done the household chores. She married and then separated from her husband, who emigrated to the US. She kept striving and opened a tortilla stand in the neighborhood. She sells every day and has to grind two quintales of corn weekly to sell tortillas. She also continues to take care of and clean homes in the city. Her efforts and daily sacrifice have helped her daughters go to school.

She is using her savings to build a brick house so that her daughters can live more comfortably. She has applied to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy 126 bags of cement, to pay 28 workers $12.00 each to finish the wall, and to pay other expenses. She has already purchased sand, iron, and other building materials. This loan will let her finish the wall under construction and the major sections of the house. She will have a decent, comfortable place to live with her daughters.

She wants to strive each day to see her daughter finish college and have professional careers. She also dreams of adding a second story to her house.

loans.use: to buy 126 bags of cement, to pay 28 workers $12.00 each to finish the wall, and to pay other expenses.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian es una joven que quiere seguir capacitándose y esforzarse por ser una gran profesional, esta estudiando la carrera de Didáctica universitaria, post grado, y especialización en finanzas. Su sueño es ser una profesional que pueda ser útil a las demás personas.
Quienes la inspiran a seguir con sus metas es su familia, ya que quiere poder ayudarles y darles todo lo que necesitan. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases y algunas cuotas que tiene, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando con tranquilidad.
texts.en: Mirian wants to continue her education and is striving to excel at her profession. She is a graduate student in Advanced Education, specializing in finance. Her dream is to be a professional who helps others. Her family has inspired her, so she wants to help them and give them what they need. She has asked for a loan to pay for college courses and other fees so that she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Sinignesigui Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SINIGNESSIGUI  II  est constitué   de 7 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans,  4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à YOROLA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 10e   prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
L’arachide et le riz sont les spéculations cultivées par MINATA   debout  avec une calebasse en main.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à BOUGOUNI, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  130 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur menage.
texts.en:
The group "SINIGNESSIGUI II" is composed of seven married women averaging 32 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in YOROLA, a village in BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their rainy season farm work. They are on their tenth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

Peanuts and rice are the crops grown by MINATA, who is standing with a calabash in hand in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 2 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in BOUGOUNI. She plans on making a profit of 130,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will enable her to pay back the loan and help her husband to cover the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and plowing for planting crops

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKOLA  est constitué    de 6 hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à  BOUGOUNI, un des cercle de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 2 eme prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Le mais  est la spéculation cultivée par DOULAYE, le 2 eme  débout de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau de la ville de BOUGOUNI, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il  compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 200.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider  dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The group "BENKOLA" is composed of six married men averaging 52 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in Cercle de BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their rainy season farm work. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loan was indeed paid back.

Corn is the crop grown by DOULAYE, who is standing second from the right in the photo. With his loan, he intends to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 1.5 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the city of BOUGOUNI. He plans on making a profit of 200,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will enable him to pay back the loan and help cover the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and plowing for planting crops

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  SINIGNESSIGUI   est constitué    de 8 hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à DIOUTIEBOUGOU, un des un des villages de BOUGOUNI  de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 4eme prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Le maïs  est la spéculation cultivée par  BROULAYE, le 2 eme  debout   dans la photo de la gauche  vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  3 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau de la ville de BOUGOUNI, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il  compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 275.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider  dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur menage.
texts.en:
The group "SINIGNESSIGUI" is composed of eight married men averaging 48 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in DIOUTIEBOUGOU, a village in BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their rainy season farm work. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loan was indeed paid back.

Corn is the crop grown by BROULAYE, who is standing second from the left in the photo. With his loan, he intends to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 3 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the city of BOUGOUNI. He plans on making a profit of 275,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will enable him to pay back the loan and help cover the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and plowing for planting crops

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en: Edilberto is a single entrepreneur who lives in Batoo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He has been running his sari sari (variety) store for more than five years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month for a living. As a new member of Gata Daku MPC, he borrowed a loan to buy rice and feeds in addition to his usual offerings. He plans to renovate his store with his generated income. He hopes to have better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to buy rice and feeds in addition to his usual offerings.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 40 year old retail shop owner in Mishomuhoroni Mombasa. He is a married man who supports three children. Anthony's wife is a housewife. 

Anthony has been operating his business for the last four years and it has been doing well.

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd, to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase stock of milk in wholesale and supply to his environs. He will use the anticipated profit to open up a milk depot in Mishomuhoroni and service his loan. He hopes to have an expanded business and increased savings in future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of milk and supply as wholesaler.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has four children. Josephine is 56 years old and resides at Bunawan, Calamba.

Josephine owns farm land, planting and harvesting corn for sale and it is their main source of income. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. Aside from farming, she also has a retail business selling goods in the community.

She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase goods like milk, sugar, sardines and spices. In 2010, Josephine joined GDMPC. In the future, Josephine wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods like milk, sugar, sardines and spices

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 24-year-old greengrocer and retailer of detergent in Kisauni, Mombasa. He is a single man, so he does not support anyone at the moment. He has been in this business for the last four years and is doing great.

This is his second loan from KADET Ltd to finance his business. He will use the loan to buy liquid detergent and fruit and vegetables for his store, and he will use the anticipated profit to service his loan and expand his business. He hopes to succeed in life and in business.

loans.use: to purchase liquid washing detergents and fruit and vegetables for his grocery.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
From Nyandarua South, Ruth is a 30-year-old married mother of five children between the ages of 15 and 1. For the past five years Ruth has been operating a quarry business and is now requesting her second loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to buy tools to use in her quarry. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan.

Ruth hopes to expand her enterprise in the near future.

loans.use: To buy tools for use in her quarry

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children who are in school, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Gemma is borrowing 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requesting a new loan to further build her food vending and farming sugarcane business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita runs a general store in the village of Bato, Plaridel, to make a living. She is 52 and is married with one child. Her husband is a farmer, and she helps to generate income with her sari sari (general) store. She has been in this business for more than six years. 

She has taken a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to purchase canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee for her store. She plans to use the generated revenue as additional capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee for her store

loans.name: 4000 Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El comité  se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de Colonia Mbarete. Son mujeres con ganas de salir adelante. Son de una colonia lejana de la ciudad de Santaní, de difícil acceso, eminentemente rural. Todas las integrantes se dedican a la cría, venta o faena de animales de corral, con lo que ayudan a sus familias a ir mejorando.
Una de ellas es Sebastiana, quien es la presidenta, comenta que ellas se ayudan y se esfuerzan por poder dar cada una a su familia lo que necesitan. Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales y así seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The communal bank comprises neighbors from Colonia Mbarete. The women, who want to be successful, live in a rural, hard-to-access area outside the city of Santaní. The members raise and sell farm animals to help their families get ahead. Sebastiana, who is one of the members and president of the group, says that the women support each other and work hard each day to provide for their families. She has applied for a loan to buy nutritious animal feed to continue the work she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy nutritious animal feed.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy an additional stock of spices, meat, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 18 years. Jocelyn earns additional income from raising livestock.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of spices, meat, vegetables, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 19-year-old single man. He has been working in the construction field since 2011. He got involved in this type of business at a very young age in order to provide extra financial support for the family. He is specialized in placing paves. He works with great professionalism and has one part-time employee helping him with the work.  Today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a winch for his business so as to proceed with his operations properly. Mohamad plans to let his employee work on a full-time basis as he is sure that he will be able to significantly expand his business and increase its capital thanks to the loan.

loans.use: purchase a winch

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 26 años vive con sus padres y hermanos, trabaja por el día y por la noche va a la Facultad, está cursando el último año de la carrera de Ingeniería en Marketing, una vez  que termine su carrera quiere seguir trabajando y así ayudar a su familia.
Quiere ser una buena profesional, con conocimientos, que sirva para poder ayudar a las personas que lo necesitan. También quiere seguir creciendo como estudiante y profesional.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus gastos de titulación, ya que son muchas las gestiones que tiene que cubrir.
texts.en:
Sonia is 26 years old and lives with her parents and siblings. She works during the day and attends higher education in the evenings. She is in the last year of her Marketing studies, and once she finishes she wants to continue working in order to help her family.

She wants to be a good professional and possess knowledge that will allow her to help people who need it. She also wants to continue developing as a student and professional. 

She is applying for this loan in order to pay for her studies, since there are a lot of expenses related to this that she needs to pay for.

loans.use: to pay for her studies

loans.name: Decisiones Group

texts.es:
Decisiones se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la Ciudad de Santani, ellas son mujeres luchadoras, que vieron una gran oportunidad de crecimiento en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y de esa forma dar cada una a su familia lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Leocadia, una de las integrantes se dedica a la cría de chancho y faena y vende en su despensa. Es una señora muy emprendedora y muy necesitada del crédito es por eso que lo solicita, para poder invertirlo en la compra de otros insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, enlatados y demás, que le serán de mucha ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
