Afin de prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle revend depuis 2005 des charbons de bois et des produits d'alimentation générale à domicile. A l'avenir, elle voudrait ouvrir une boutique et prendre soin de la famille. Elle est âgée de 41ans avec 08ans d'ancienneté.
texts.en: Dovi lives with her husband and their two children in Lomé.  In order to assist her husband with the household's expenses, she has been reselling charcoal and general food products from her home since 2005.  In the future, she would like to open a shop and take care of her family.  Dovi is 41 years old and has been involved in this activity for eight years.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin, 21 years old, is from a mountainous village of Isabela. He went into farming at a very young age, to help his family provide their immediate necessities. He is asking for a loan amounting to PHP15,000 to buy seeds to grow and fertilizers for his crop maintenance and development. He hopes that lenders will provide him the loan. He is doing his best to make his crop yield better.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow, and fertilizer for the maintenance and growth of his crop

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr: Agathe est une femme de 50 ans, veuve et mère de 06 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 17 et 27 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont encore à l'école et elle a également à sa charge quatre de ses petits fils. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 05 ans où elle vend des vivres frais (maïs, bananes, plantains) selon les saisons.la vente de bananes et plantains est une activité qui rapporte, mais la petitesse de son stock de marchandises entraine de nombreuses ruptures  et ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Ce crédit lui permettra alors  de s'approvisionner en grande quantité afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et de ce fait  d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité afin de le diversifier et l'autre pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agathe is a 50-year-old widow and the mother of six children whose ages range between 27 and 17.  Two of her children are still in school and she also takes care of four of her grandsons.  She has been working as a retailer at a market in Yaoundé for five years, selling fresh foods such as maize, bananas and plantains depending on the season.

Although the sale of bananas and plantains is a lucrative business, Agathe often faces shortages and cannot adequately satisfy the needs of her customers because of her small stock of merchandise.

This loan will help her to buy bulk quantities of merchandise in order to meet customer demand, and therefore increase her sales and profits.

Agathe will reinvest part of her profits in her activity, in order to diversify it, and will use the rest to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of plantains and bananas.

loans.name: San Antonio Poty Group

texts.es:
San Antonio Poty tiene 17 miembros, donde cada una se está esforzando por mejorar y crecer por medio de las capacitaciones. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder saber cómo esta cada una de ellas y ayudarlas de acuerdo al resultado.
Una persona que se destaca en el grupo es Mirna, quien es una persona trabajadora y que lucha por salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, un trabajo muy sacrificado pero por sobre todo muy honrado, con el que ella se esfuerza por generar los ingresos de su familia.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, ya que al comprarlo por cantidad tendrá mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
San Antonio Poty has 17 members, each one of whom is making the effort to improve and grow through the trainings.  They're doing the poverty-elimination survey so they'll know where each one stands and to help them according to the results.

Someone who stands out in this group is Mirna, a hardworking person who strives to get ahead.  She earns a living selling natural remedies.  It's a very demanding but honorable job.  She works hard to generate income for her family.

She's requesting this help to be able to buy natural remedies to sell, because when she buys in bulk she'll earn better profits.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies

loans.name: Naleem

texts.en:
Naleem is 27 years old and a married woman. She has been doing a business of crockery sales for the past two years. She offers various types of dinnerware, such as glasses, dinner sets, and bowls. Her husband assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in a local market. Naleem also sells clothing, to generate an extra amount of revenue.

For the improvement of her business, Naleem contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. With this loan capital, she would be able to purchase a greater variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls and glasses, in various sizes and designs. She is hoping to get an increase in her earnings, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of crockery, such as tea sets, bowls and glasses, in various sizes and designs

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado SANTA ROSA está en su ciclo número 1, ellas están empezando a trabajar juntas, fomentando el espíritu emprendedor de cada una. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y lo llamativo es que dos de estas mujeres están con ingresos muy bajos.
AURELIA es una de estas mujeres, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que vende galletitas, lácteos, embutidos entre otros, también va cargando en pequeñas cantidades como Gaseosas, agua Mineral, y entre otros tipos de bebidas. Es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos como mas Gaseosas, Lácteos, panificados como galleta, coquitos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Santa Rosa" Group is in its first season. The members are beginning to work together, encouraging each other in an entrepreneurial spirit. 

They are participating in the survey for the elimination of poverty, and what is striking is that two of the women are at very low income levels. 

Aurelia is one of these women who is overcoming poverty through effort, continuous work, and with the actions and behaviours that are vital for a successful woman. Among the jobs that she does, she sells cookies, dairy products, and sausages etc. She also carries with her small quantities of soft drinks, mineral water, and other types of drinks. She is a hard-working woman who is attempting to make some progress and help her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies such as drinks, dairy products, and baked goods like cookies and "coquitos" - sticky coconut treats. 

This will help her implement her business plan and will help increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, dairy products, and baked goods such as cookies and "coquitos" - sticky coconut treats.

loans.name: Marie Florette

texts.fr: Marie Florette est une femme mariée de 39 ans sans enfant à sa charge. pour s'installer à son propre compte,elle a entrepris dans la commercialisation de poissons à la braise dans un marché de la place depuis 04 ans. au regard de sa clientèle grandissante,elle aimerait toujours satisfaire ses ces clients. raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter le stock de poissons.ceci lui permettra de réaliser des économies d'échelle et améliorer ses conditions de vie. à long terme,elle aimeraitmettre en place un restaurant digne de ce nom.
texts.en:
Marie Florette is a married woman who is 39 years of age and has no dependent children. To establish herself of her own account, she began selling grilled fish in the market place four years ago.

In light of her growing customer base, which she wants to continue to satisfy, Marie Florette is requesting a loan to increase her stock of fish. This will enable her to benefit from economies of scale in her business. She will also be able to improve her living conditions. In the long term, she would like to open up a restaurant worthy of the name.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of fish for grilling.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKADI I    est constitué de10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de   38  ans, 5  enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KASSELA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur  11éme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le  riz   est la spéculation cultivée de   KOURA  la 1ére femme assise  de la droite vers la gauche .
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1.5 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à BOUGOUNI, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The Benkadi I Group is made up of ten married women who have an average age of 38 years, and an average of five children. They are all living in polygamous families in Kassela, one of the villages of Bougouni, third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their eleventh loan with the institution, and their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Koura, shown seated on the far right in the photo, grows crops of rice. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor needed to maintain one and a half hectares of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market and in Bougouni to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 150,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with their daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor needed during the agricultural cycle.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 42 years old, married and a mother of five children. For the past five years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of about KES 6,000 from the business.

Patricia was introduced to KADET by our credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000. She will use the loan to buy additional stock to sell to customers at her kiosk, such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, and onions. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children, as well as to continue expanding the business. Patricia's goal for the future is to continue growing the business, so that she may help uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell to customers at her kiosk, such as tomatoes, pineapples and oranges

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is married with five children, and  lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer, while she runs business buying nipa leaves and selling woven nipa hut leaves in town. 

She has been doing this for many years to earn a living. She made a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy more nipa palm leaves and to finance  labor costs. She has planned to save a portion of her income for the future needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa palm leaves and finance labor costs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Edna works hard to support her family. She has a direct-selling business, selling Avon products in the Philippines. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Edna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional stock of Avon products to sell, in her direct-selling business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKADI II est constitué 8   de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans,  4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à    KASSELA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 11éme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le riz  est la spéculation cultivée de   SANAMBA       la 1ére  femme  debout     de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  150 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The Benkadi II Group is made up of eight married women who have an average age of 32 years, and an average of four children. They are all living in polygamous families in Kassela, one of the villages of Bougouni, third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their eleventh loan with the institution, and their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Sanamba, shown standing on the far right in the photo, grows crops of rice. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor needed to maintain two hectares of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 150,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with their daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor needed during the agricultural cycle.

loans.name: Moein

texts.en:
Moein is a 38-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. His wife doesn’t work, and nor does his child.  That’s why Moein works impressively to make as much money as necessary to satisfy his family’s needs. 

His job consists of selling fish to traders and multiple stores. He works independently, dealing with loyal merchants. Today, he is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a large quantity of fish in order to increase his sales and obtain needed legal papers so as to continue his product distribution's operations properly without facing any legal problems.

 In the future, Moein plans to open his own fishery.

loans.use: purchase fish and obtain needed legal papers.

loans.name: Sinignessigui I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  SINIGNESSIGUI I   est constitué  8  de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  40    ans, 4  enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à   YOROLA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 10éme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le riz  est la spéculation cultivée de    FANTA     la 1ére femme debout de la droite vers la gauche .
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à BOUGOUNI, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 150 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The SINIGNESSIGUI I group is made up of eight married women who are, on average, 40 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Yorola, one of the villages of the Bougouni Cercle, (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their tenth loan with the institution, and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

Fanta, a member of the group, is a rice farmer. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy some farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain two hectares (4.9 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she will sell her crop in her village and in Bougouni, to a customer base consisting of men and women.

She is expecting to make a profit of 150,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the household's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to cover plowing costs during the growing season.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 36 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling fish in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 9,000. 

Helen was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of KES 20,000 to buy additional fish stock for her business to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as to expand her business. 

Her goal for the future is to continue with her business with a possibility of owning a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: to add additional stock of fish to her business

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BENKADI I  est constitué 10 de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de   48  ans, 5  enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  DISSAN, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 5éme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le   riz  est la spéculation cultivée par  ALIMA       la 3éme femme  debout     de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  0,25hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à SIDO, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 50.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The BENKADI I group is made up of ten married women who are, on average, 48 years old with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Dissan, one of the villages of the Bougouni Cercle, (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their fifth loan with the institution, and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

Alima, a member of the group, is a rice farmer. In the photo, she is in the standing row, third from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy some farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain 0.25 hectare (0.6 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she will sell her crop in her village and in Sido, to a customer base consisting of men and women.

She is expecting to make a profit of 50,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the household's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to cover plowing costs during the farming season.

loans.name: Rosángela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rosangela madre de familia que a sus 60 años se dedica a la sastrería, desde muy joven dedicada al trabajo de la confección, en estos momentos trabaja como independiente en el taller de su hija, quien esperan juntas crecer en el mercado y que el negocio se consolide a nivel regional.
El crédito será utilizado para la compra de maquinaria plana, lo cual se asegura un incremento en los ingresos totales del taller.
texts.en:
At 60 years of age, Rosangela is the mother of a family and makes a living by tailoring. She has made a living by making clothing from a very young age. At this time she works independently in her daughter's workshop. Together they hope to grow in the market and to expand the business in the region. 

The loan will be used for the purchase of a flat-bed sewing machine, which will ensure an increase in the total earnings of the workshop.

loans.use: to buy a flat-bed sewing machine

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de conocer la situación de cada una de las integrantes de este grupo. Ellas se están esforzando para ir mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Ubaldina es una persona trabajadora, se está esforzando por ir mejorando su nivel de ingresos por medio de su trabajo. Ella vende lencería de todo tipo y tiene muy buena clientela por lo que le va muy bien.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de lencería tanto para hombre como para mujeres, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas y apoyar a su familia con los ingresos que obtenga.
texts.en:
Renacer is doing the poverty-elimination survey as a means of finding out the status of each one of the group members.  They're making the effort to improve their economic status.

Ubaldina's a hardworking person.  She's making the effort to improve her income level with her job.  She sells all types of lingerie and has very good customers, so it's going very well for her.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy underwear for both men and women.  This way she'll continue with her sales and support her family with all the income she receives.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and underwear

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Kyrey 2 está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer su situación y con ello poder ir mejorando de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Hermelinda es una de las integrantes, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se está esforzando para dar a su familia lo que necesitan y que de esa forma no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones. Ella vende cosméticos y de esa forma puede tener los ingresos que necesita.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de todas las marcas y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named "Kuña Kyrey 2" is in its fifth phase of the Poverty Stoplight Program. They are using the poverty measurement tool to understand their situation and move away from poverty. 

Hermelinda is one of the group members. She is a hard working woman who is striving to give her family what they need so they do not have to go through any hardship. 

She sells cosmetics and in this way earns the income she needs. 

She is asking for this loan so she can invest in buying cosmetics of all brands. This way she can keep selling as she has been doing.

loans.use: buy cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индира, 36 лет, разведена, имеет 1 дочь. Образование-высшее. Долгое время работала в России - медсестрой. Вернулась обратно в Кыргызстан, на данный момент устраивается в местную больницу в качестве медсестры. Более 13 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве имеется: 2 бычка. Ежемесячная прибыль от ее хозяйства 7000 сом (KGS). По характеру Индира- отзывчивая, честная, трудолюбивая, она одна воспитывает свою дочь, чтобы обеспечить достойное будущее для своей дочери Индира обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70 000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Индира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в будущем хочет дать достойное образование своей единственной дочери.
texts.en: Indira is 36 years old, divorced and has one daughter.  She has a higher education.  She had worked in Russia as a nurse for a long time.  She returned to Kyrgyzstan and is currently looking to be hired as a nurse at a local hospital.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 13 years, having started this business with 5,000 som (KGS).  Today her business contains two bulls.  The monthly profit from the business is 7,000 som (KGS).  Indira is caring, honest and hardworking.  She is raising her daughter alone.  In order to provide a decent future for her daughter, Indira requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy bulls.  Indira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in further increasing livestock quantities in her business and also wants to provide a decent education for her only daughter.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 27 year old single businessman. He lives in Mombasa, Kenya. 

He is a hawker, and he sells small consumables and items like sweets, biscuits and batteries. He does not have a specific product that he focuses on, but rather his stock is determined by what sells best and is in demand.  This is his only source of income. He knew Milango through a friend, and he decided to join when he learned that he can be funded in his business. He has been doing this for three years, and has managed to buy a motorcycle. He employed someone to transport people with the motorcycle. 

He seeks a loan to buy retail products like sweets, balloons and batteries for his hawking business. He wants to save for the future and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of torches, wallets, combs, sweets, etc. for selling.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 29 лет. Она проживает со своей семьей в городе Душанбе. Шахноза имеет высшее экономическое образование, но после замужества не работала по своей специальности. 
Сейчас Шахноза решила работать и быть независимой женщиной. Мать Шахнозы имеет успешный торговый бизнес. Она торгует тканями и материалами. Шахноза имеет намерение тоже начать собственный торговый бизнес. Она уже арендовала торговую точку на центральном рынке города. Стартовый капитал Шахнозы составляет 1000 долларов США. Однако этой суммы недостаточно, чтобы закупить товар. Поэтому Шахноза обратилась за кредитом. Она на сумму кредита и своего сбережения хочет закупить ткани материалы и начать торговлю. По словам Шахнозы поставщиком товара для нее будет ее мать, которая привозит товар с Турции. Шахноза верит, что ее бизнес тоже будет успешным, так как ей будет помогать мать. 
Благодаря кредиту у Шахнозы будет свой бизнес, который будет приносить ей хороший доход.
texts.en: Shahnoza is a young, married 29 year-old woman.  She lives with her family in the city of Dushanbe.  Shahnoza has a higher education in economics, but has not worked in her profession since getting married.  Now Shahnoza decided to work and be an independent woman.  Shahnoza's mother has a successful retail business.  She sells fabrics and materials.  Shahnoza has intentions to also start her own retail business.  She already leased a retail outlet at the central market of the city.  Shahnoza's starting capital amounts to 1000 US dollars.  However, this amount is not enough to purchase merchandise.  This is why Shahnoza requested a loan.  Shahnoza wants to use the loan and her savings to purchase fabrics and materials and start her sales.  According to Shahnoza's words, her mother, who brings merchandise from Turkey, will be the supplier of merchandise.  Shahnoza believes that her business will also be successful because her mother will be helping her.  Thanks to the loan, Shahnoza will have her own business, which will yield her a good income.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials to start her own retail business

loans.name: Erna

texts.ru: Эрна, 32 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей (2 сына). Образование-высшее. С 2011 года занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 25000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль 20000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она смогла развить животноводческую и полеводческую деятельность. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 20 овец и 4 козы, а также имеется земельный надел размером 2,10 ГА на которой она ежегодно выращивает фасоль. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства и полеводства Эрна обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75 000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Эрна планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота, и в будущем Эрна хочет улучшить благосостояние семьи, дав достойное образование своим детям.
texts.en: Erna is 32 years old, married, and two children (two sons). She has a college degree. From 2011, she has been growing farm produce and raising livestock, having launched this business from a starting capital of 25,000 KGS. She has been able to expand her livestock and produce business. At present, she has three diary cows, 20 sheep and four goats as well as   2.1 ha [about 5 acres] of land, where she grows beans every year. Her husband helps her in her business. In order to develop her farming business further, Erna has applied to the “Bai Tushum and Partners” microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 75,000 KGS to buy cows. Erna plans to use the resulting revenues to increase her livestock headcount, and in the future she would like to improve her family’s life conditions and  ensure a proper education for her children.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Gulbakhar

texts.ru: Гулбахар 26 лет, замужем, имеет 1 сына. С 2008 года Гулбахар начала заниматься торговлей женской одежды, стартовав с суммой в 20,000 сом (KGS), Гулбахар сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, Гулбахар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Гулбахар планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара, а также в будущем хочет построить дом.
texts.en: Gulbakhar is 26 years old, married and has one son.  She has been involved in selling women's clothing since 2008, having started this business with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS).  Gulbakhar was able to grow her business to have a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to expand her merchandise selection, Gulbakhar requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners."  Gulbakhar plans to invest the earnings from the business in a continued expansion of merchandise selection and also wants to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing for resale and expand her merchandise selection

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon is 50 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Maricon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, oil, sugar, etc. to sell.

Maricon has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Maricon aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, oil, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 47 year old married woman doing business in milk sales for the past two years. She has two cows in milk. She milks cows on daily basis, and then sells their milk to her neighbors. She also stores milk in cans, and has become famous for providing fresh and healthy milk. 

She is a mother of two children, and is motivated to provide her children with the basic necessities of life. In order to expand her business, she requested for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase one more cow and some cans for milk storage. She hopes to increase milk production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and milk cans.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is 39 years old and married. He likes to spend time with his family during his free time. They live happily in the village of Simanu. 

Dominador makes a living through farming, growing a rice crop. He is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy inputs, such as fertilizer, and to pay for the labor cost spent on farming. He sometimes faces challenges, especially with the farm products' prices in the market, but he is courageous enough in taking the risk in the farming business. 

Dominador's dream is to expand his business, to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy inputs, such as fertilizer, and to pay for the labor cost spent on farming.

loans.name: Esperanza 2 Mbocayaty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Esperanza 2 Mbocayaty está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 7 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos mensuales, pero lo cual les inspira a seguir luchando por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silvia, que con esfuerzo y trabajo se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella es una persona con ansias de mejorar e ir creciendo. Vende ropas de todo tipo y con ello ayuda a su familia y cubre los gastos del día a día.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que estamos en la época de frío y quiere poder tener una buena variedad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Esperanza 2 Mbocayaty group is requesting its first loan. They have been carrying out poverty surveys in which they have found that 7 members live below the poverty line, i.e. they have a very low monthly income, which has inspired them to do better.
Silvia is one of the members of the group, who through hard-work is managing to work her way out of poverty. She is impatient to do better and grow. She sells clothing of all types and uses the income from this to help her family and cover the daily expenses. 
She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of winter clothing, now that the cold season has begun and she wants to have a variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras está en su ciclo número 10 ° Del programa de comité, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas. Son mujeres que se están esforzando por mejorar sus vidas y la de su familia.
Carmen es parte de este grupo, ella por medio de la venta de prendas usadas es que está saliendo adelante, teniendo los ingresos para ayudar a su familia y poco a poco ir superando su situación de pobreza. Es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha y trabaja duro.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas usadas para poder venderlas, ya que tiene muy buena demanda y quiere poder satisfacer los pedidos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadores (Determined Women) group is requesting its 10th loan from the program. They have been carrying out poverty elimination surveys to find out about each woman’s situation. They are women who are working hard to improve their and their families’ lives. 
Carmen is a member of the group and is managing to get ahead through her business of selling second-hand clothing. She uses the income to help her family and little by little is working her way out of poverty. She is a hard-working and determined woman. 
She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of second-hand clothing to sell. She has a lot of customer demand and wants to have the supply to meet their orders.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Clemensio

texts.en:
Clemensio is a 50-year-old widow, with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a food vendor in the rural area for 13 years and she works 12 hours a day. She also does farming for additional income. 

Clemensio started her business to have a source of income and she wants money to buy beans, onions, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes to sell. She hopes to expand her business into new areas, however, lack of sufficient capital is her challenge.

loans.use: to buy beans, onions, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es: Berta es una mujer de 26 años que trabaja toda la semana vendiendo comidas (salpicón y fritos en general) es una mujer emprendedora, con ganas de salir adelante, ella solicito el préstamo de $ 700.000 para la compra de insumos y de activos para su pequeño negocio como sillas y mesas, generando así más comodidad para sus clientes y además de eso ofrecer variedad de productos e ir fidelizándolos; ella vive en una casa de madera y espera seguir avanzando en su negocio para poder algún día comprar su vivienda construida en buenos materiales.
texts.en:
Berta, 26, works all week selling food ("salpicón" and fried food in general).  She's an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead.

She requested a loan for 700,000 pesos [COP] to buy supplies and assets such as tables and chairs for her small business.  This way she'll give her customers greater comfort and a variety of products to increase their loyalty.

She lives in a house made of wood and hopes to continue making progress in her business so one day she'll be able to buy a house built of good materials.

loans.use: to buy supplies, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma tiene 58 años, está casada con el Sr. Víctor, tiene un establecimiento de 100 hectáreas de tierra, de las cuales 50 habilita para la producción de carbón.
También se dedica a la venta ambulante en su vecindario y a la cría y venta de ganados. El es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha y se esfuerza por ir creciendo.
Solicitó el préstamo para construcción de piso y muralla en su establecimiento, ya que le permitirá tener una mejor recepción en sus ventas. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Irma, 58, is married to Victor. They have 100 hectares of land; 50 of which are used for coal production. She also breeds and raises cattle, and makes sales walking around her neighborhood. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person who fights and strives to keep growing. She is requesting this loan for the construction of walls and flooring at their establishment, as it will enable her to have better sales. She is grateful for the assistance she is getting as it will help her out a lot.

loans.use: to construct walls and flooring.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
San Antonio está en su segundo ciclo, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de ellas están por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero siguen luchando y esforzándose el doble.
Ursulina es una de las integrante de este grupo, ella es modista y excelente profesional, hace todo tipo de confecciones y de esa forma se gana la vida. Es muy luchadora y por medio de su trabajo está mejorando su situación de pobreza. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos para poder seguir con su trabajo y sus confecciones para poder seguir también generando los ingresos para crecer en su negocio y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The San Antonio group is in its second loan cycle. Its members are doing the elimination of poverty survey, as three of them are below the poverty line, meaning that they have very low incomes -- but they keep striving and making double the effort.

Ursulina is one of the members of this group. She is a dressmaker and an excellent professional. She makes all kinds of clothing and in this way she makes a living. She is a very hard-working woman and by means of her work she is improving her situation of poverty. She is currently asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics and thread to be able to continue with her work and her clothing. In this way, she will keep generating income to grow in her business and help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a man of thirty five years, married to Susan and the father of three children.  He sells secondhand shoes in Soweto, in the outskirts of Kangemi; he has been in this business for 14 years, and gets a monthly income of 60,000 shillings.

This will be Elijah's second loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy secondhand shoes to sell. 

In the future, he wants to open a good shop, and feed and educate his family.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector is a 35-year-old man from Talibon, Bohol. For 16 years now, he has been buying and selling shellfish for an income, together with his wife. He works hard so he can provide for their day-to-day needs like food, water, and electricity. 

To achieve a better income, he is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more shellfish to sell.

In the future, Hector hopes to expand his business and start a Sari-sari store for additional profit.

loans.use: to  buy more shellfish to sell.

loans.name: Anees

texts.en:
Anees is a 40-year-old, married woman. For many years, she has been running a small general store in her community. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough money to provide for her family. 

To fully-stock her store, Anees requested a loan for PKR 30,000 which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Anees wishes to utilize part of the revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour to sell.

loans.name: Mila Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children who are in school, Mila Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending. Mila Fe is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her buy-and-sell rice business.

Mila Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn, who is single, works hard to support her family with her fish vending enterprise in the Philippines. In business for two years, she has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Genalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jackelyn

texts.en:
Jackelyn is a married woman who has three children. She is 28 years old and resides in Gabunon, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

To earn a living, Jackelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products. She's been in this business for more than five years and each month she earns PHP 3,000 from it.

She requested a new loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase items such as sugar, noodles, sardines, milk, and other products to sell. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to gain access to financial services, to help improve her business and living situation. 

In the future, Jackelyn wants to build a house and support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase items such as sugar, noodles, sardines, and milk.

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es:
Las Poderosas es un grupo que esta trabajando por ir mejorando su vida, son mujeres jefas de familia que decidieron esforzarse por ir mejorando su vida y la de sus familias.
A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo ellas se encuentran mejorando su situación. Una de ellas es Luz, quien es peluquera, además comenta que es muy buena en lo que hace y que siempre tiene muy buena clientela.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su peluquería como ser tintes, tijeras, ruleros, pinzas y demás, que le servirá para poder seguir trabajando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Las Poderosas Group is working to improve their lives.  They're mothers and heads of household who decided to make the effort to improve their families' lives.  Through their effort and constant work they're improving their status.

One of the women is Luz, a hairstylist.  She says she's very good at what she does and always has very good customers.

She's requesting this loan to invest in buying supplies for her hair salon such as dyes, scissors, curlers, clips, and other things that will help her be able to continue working and providing good customer service.

loans.use: to buy dye, scissors, curlers, clips, and other supplies

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija, age 24, is involved in the business of clothing sales. She buys a variety of children's clothes from the main city market and sells them to the people of her local community. She is a mother of three children. 

Khadija started her business because it was very difficult for her to meet her household needs with only the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband in earning money. Now, she plays a very important role in supporting her family. 

In order to purchase a greater selection of clothes in different colors and sizes, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase a greater selection of clothes in different colors and sizes to sell.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 16 ° Del programa de comité  son mujeres que están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ir mejorando su calidad de vida. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de pobreza como medio de conocer la situación de cada una de las integrantes.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Antonia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir con nivel de ingresos medios. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella tienen un copetín en el que tiene todo tipo de comestibles, bebidas, golosinas y demás productos, gracias a la buena variedad que tiene está teniendo cada vez más una mejor clientela. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de galletitas, jugos, golosinas, panificados y demás productos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres San Cayetano [San Cayetano Women] is in its 16th loan cycle of the committee’s programme. The members of the group are all women who are learning to work together and are improving their quality of life. They are doing the Poverty Spotlight programme as a way of finding out the situation of each member.

Antonia is a member of the group. In the last survey they did in the Poverty Spotlight programme, her level of poverty was 2, that is she has an average income. Through her own efforts, continuous hard work and the energy and enthusiasm of a successful woman, she is improving her economic situation. She runs a small fast food business selling all types of food and drinks, as well as sweets and other products. Thanks to the variety of products that she stocks, her customer base is improving. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person.

She is requesting this loan to buy biscuits, juices, sweets, baked goods and other products. This will help her to finalise her business plan, which in turn will help increase her income.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, juices, sweets, baked goods and other products.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 62 years old and widowed with seven children.

Nelly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shampoo, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.  Nelly has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years, and also earns an income from farming rice.

Nelly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shampoo, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Bashira

texts.en:
Bashira is a 48 year old married woman.  She deals in the business of milk sales. She has five buffaloes.  She sells good quality milk in her community, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

She has three sons and three daughters, two of whom go to school. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation.  She is happily running her business with its support. 

Now she requested for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase a cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to increase milk production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She dreams of providing quality education to her children for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru:
Музаффар является опытным земледельцем, проживающим в селе района Носири Хусрав. Ему 43 года. Он женат и является многодетным отцом. У него семеро детей. Музаффар арендует 2,5 га участка земли, на котором выращивает  бахчевую культуру, хлопок и пшеницу. Он занимается земледелием уже 7 лет. Ему в деятельности помогает жена и один сын. Старший сын находится на заработках за пределами страны. Остальные дети школьники. 
Музаффару сейчас необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить хороший качественный урожай арбуза и дыни. Он просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений и топлива. 
Его цель на будущее - приобретение земли и расширение деятельности.
texts.en: Muzaffer is an experienced farmer living in a rural village called Nisiri Khusrav.  He is 43 years old, married and has children, of which there are seven.  Muzaffer rents 2.5 hectares of land on which he grows vine crops, cotton and wheat.  He has been farming for seven years.  His wife and one of his sons helps him with the business.  His oldest son is a migrant worker in a nearby country.  The rest of the children are in school.  Muzaffer must fertilize his crops to have a quality melon harvest.  He's asking for a loan to buy the fertilizer and fuel.  His future goals including buying land and expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel for his melon harvest

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking mother from Manila, Philippines. This is her fifth loan cycle and she is convinced that her loan is always helping her, not just in her business but also with her family's everyday expenses. There are times when her sales aren't good but her hopes are always high that God will help her through. She continues to work hard for her family's sake.

She would now like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of decorative plastic flowers and plants needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elsa's dreams is to be successful in life and business. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business. She draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of God that she studies. 

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of decorative plastic flowers and plants needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost her business by purchasing more fish to sell.

loans.name: Robeena

texts.en:
Robeena is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field.  Her husband assists her by purchasing her stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Robeena is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, flour and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She expects a boost in her earning and wishes to spend part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, flour and beverages.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina has successfully built her business of milk sales with the help of Kashf Foundation and Kiva loans. 

She has six buffaloes in milk and she sells good quality milk in her community. By this time she has retained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

In order to fulfill the increasing demands of her customers, she needs to purchase a cow in milk. For this she applied for her third loan in the amount of 35,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. Sakina hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in milk.

loans.name: Safarmahmad

texts.ru: Сафармахмад житель района Гиссар. Ему 26 лет. Он женат и имеет двух маленьких детей - сына и дочку. Сафармахмад предприимчивый и деятельный человек. Он намерен начать торговый бизнес в сфере продуктов питания. Сафармахмад построил помещение для магазина. У него на руках осталось 3000 сомони (TJS). Теперь ему необходимо провести ремонт в магазине и закупить продукты питания. Ему не хватает еще немного денег и поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Сафармахмад добавив сумму кредита на сумму сбережения собирается сперва провести ремонт в магазине и затем приобрести товар. Он будет очень признателен за поддержку.
texts.en: Safarmahmad is a resident of Gissar, Tajikistan.  He is 26 ears old, married and has two small children, a son and a daughter.  He is an enterprising and energetic person.  He's set on starting his own business selling groceries.  Safarmahmad has built a building to be his store.  He has 3,000 TJS left.  Now he must put the finishing touches on the building and buy food goods.  He doesn't have quite enough money so he's asking for a loan.  Safarmahmad, combining his savings with the funds from the loan, will first finish the building and then buy his inventory.  He is grateful for the support.

loans.use: to make repairs to his store and buy food products to open a business.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Massah from Kandeh town Bo, Southern area in Freetown. She is married with seven children between the ages of 6 years and 28 years. Four of her children are attending school.   

Massah runs a cooked food business; she sells cooked rice, fried fish and cool drinks. She has been running this business for 20 years. She wakes up at 4:30 am to prepare her food business, and she will not rest until the food is finished. One of her daughters usually helps her to run the cooked food business. Her business is the only source of income she has. Massah describes her major hardship: sometimes to prepare the cooked food is very difficult.  

Massah has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking item including a bag of rice, coconut oil and soft drinks and Pure Water. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change the cooked food structure where she works and serves the food and educate her children. In the future, she plans to have her own residence. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking item including a bag of rice, coconut oil and soft drinks and Pure Water.

loans.name: Joveta

texts.en:
Joveta is 27 years old from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children. Her eldest is 7 and her youngest is 2. For one year now, Joveta has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business for income. This help support the needs of her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy stocks of seasonings, canned goods, detergent, shampoo and body soap.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make a bigger store so she can continue to educate her children and support her family's future needs.

loans.use: to buy seasonings, canned goods, detergent, shampoo and body soap

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 25 years old and married. He owns a music store in Mombasa that has been in operation for two years now. He is also a carpenter by training, and he concentrates on carpentry. His music store is managed by a person he has employed to run the business. 

He knew about Milango through friends, and now seeks a loan to buy movie discs and music discs and tapes for his music store. The income raised will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy movie discs and music discs and tapes for his music store.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen, age 43, is a married woman and a mother of three. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband alone works for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household or the educational needs of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Parveen hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Daryl

texts.en:
Daryl, 22 years old, is living harmoniously together with his parents at the village of Simanu Norte. According to his parents, Daryl is a very kind person; he makes sure that he can help them in the financial aspects of their life. 

Daryl is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow for his farming business, to help his parents and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow for his farm business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 40 years old and married to Rose, who helps him meet some of the family's financial needs through her poultry farming business. They are blessed with four children, ages 7 to 17. Joseph runs a brick making business in Kapsabet as well as small-scale dairy farm. He has been in these businesses for the last four years generating a monthly income of KES 14,000. He has borrowed 70000 KES which he will use to pay wages for workers that assist him in making bricks. He anticipates getting profits from the business which he will use the to pay his loan and his children's fees.

loans.use: To pay wages to workers in his brick-making business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Juana works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Juana is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Juana has been sustaining her business activities through her past  four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia is 30 years old and a married woman with two children. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and health care. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenses of the family. She started her business of stitching clothes to contribute in the family income. She is familiar with stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list. She requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of buttons, needles and elastics. Then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of buttons, needles and elastics.

loans.name: Summra

texts.en:
Summra is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for the past five years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. 

Summra hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
É oficialmente solteiro, mas vive maritalmente em casa própria, tem 54 anos de idade, natural de Moamba e pai de 12 filhos, 7 dos quais maiores de idade, 3 já trabalham e 4 já com seus lares e os restantes ainda na sua responsabilidade. Vive de negócio há longos anos, tem 2 estabelecimentos comerciais, 1 em sua casa e outro numa zona em expansão. Com o empréstimo vai comprar produtos alimentares como arroz, farinha, açúcar, óleo, fósforos, refrescos, cervejas e vinhos para reforçar o seu negócio.
Para além do negócio, ele tem uma carrinha com a qual fornece água à população vizinha. Ele tem esperança de fazer subir o seu negócio, melhorar suas condições de vida e aumentar o número de cabeças de gado que ele tem a criar. Ele tem várias despesas pelo facto de ter muitos filhos, razão pela qual na idade que está ainda não conseguiu alcançar os seus objectivos, o que ele considera ser seu maior desafio.
texts.en:
Antonio is officially single, but he's in a common law marriage. He lives in a house that he owns. He's 54 years old and comes from Moamba. He has 12 children, 7 of whom are adults - 3 of them are in the workforce and 4 of them already have their own homes. The rest of the children are still under his responsibility. He has been a businessman for several years. He owns two stores, one located in his house and another one in a currently expanding area. With the loan he'll purchase foodstuffs such as rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, matches, refreshments, beer and wine in order to bolster his business.
Aside from his business, he owns a van with which he provides water for the neighboring population. He hopes to upgrade his business, improve his living conditions and expand the cattle herd he raises. Because he has many children, he has a lot of expenses, which is why at his age he still hasn't accomplished his goals, which he considers to be his biggest challenge.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, matches, refreshments, beer and wine in order to bolster his business.

loans.name: Caterine

texts.es: Caterine es una joven de 23 años, ella es una mujer que con su trabajo diario logra salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo, solicito un crédito por $1.000.000 para comprar insumos para su negocio de comida (carne, mazorca, arepas) ella trabaja en los parques públicos o en eventos que se realicen en la ciudad, para ella esta es su fuente de ingresos y con esto espera avanzar cada día más logrando que su negocio crezca para luego heredarlo a sus descendientes.
texts.en: Caterine is a young 23-year-old. Through her daily hard work, she is able to get ahead. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 [COP] for the purchase of supplies for her food business (meat, corn, and arepas). She sells in the public parks or at events in the city. This is her source of income, and she hopes to improve every day. She hopes that her business will grow so that she can leave it as an inheritance for her descendants.

loans.use: to buy meat, corn, and arepas.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda, a sus 34 años de edad vive en unión libre con su pareja y no tiene hijos. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde su padre le enseñó las labores agropecuarias; por lo que actualmente se dedica a la producción y venta de leche, en un pequeño lote que le presta su padre y por ser hija única su padre le dejará como herencia el ganado y el terreno que tiene, el día que fallezca. Fernanda es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora, activa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por esa razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una vaca productora de leche, de esta manera aumentará su producción y por lo tanto tendrá más ingresos por la venta del líquido. Esto le ayudará a mejorar su calidad de vida y podrá cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio para que sea perdurable en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Fernanda, age 34, is in a common-law marriage and has no children. She has spent her whole life in the country, where her father taught her to work in agriculture. She now produces and sells milk on her small plot of land which her father has lent her. Because she is an only child, her father will leave her his livestock and land when he passes away. 
Fernanda is a hard-working woman who is very active and has a great desire to succeed. For this reason, she is requesting a loan. She will invest it in the purchase of a dairy cow. This will increase her production, so she will have a greater income. This will help her to improve her quality of life, and she will be able to reach her dream of expanding her business so that it lasts a long time.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Assia

texts.pt:
É viúva há 4 anos, tem 34 anos de idade e vive na casa própria com os seus 2 filhos menores, um na oitava classe e outro na sexta. Assia tem nível médio e actualmente está a frequentar o ensino superior à distância. 
Ela trabalha como assistente técnica na secretaria da escola secundária. Com o valor de empréstimo ela pretende investir na compra de cimento, varão de ferro e chapas de zinco para dar continuidade à construção de sua casa que iniciou há 3 anos.
Ássia tem a esperança de aumentar o seu nível de escolaridade e melhorar a sua carreira profissional, terminar a construção de sua casa e garantir um futuro melhor para os seus filhos. O seu maior desafio está nos seus rendimentos que são muito baixos para suportar as várias despesas que tem.
texts.en:
Assia was widowed four years ago. She's 34 years old and lives with her two underage children in a house that she owns. One of her children is in 8th grade and the other one is in 6th grade. Assia graduated high school and she's currently attending college through distance learning.
She works as an administrative assistant for a high school office. With the amount from the loan she intends to purchase cement, iron rods and metal sheets in order to continue building her house, which she started three years ago.
Assia hopes to raise her level of schooling and make improvements in her career. She also hopes to finish building her house and ensure a better future for her children. Her biggest challenge is the fact that her income is very low for covering the many expenses she has.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron rods and metal sheets in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
Javier, una persona joven de 20 años de edad, llena de muchos sueños, se ha crecido en una familia emprendedora. Ahora Javier es padre de familia de una niña de 6 meses, vive con su compañera de vida en la comunidad.
sus padres le enseñaron los trabajos de la agricultura, la albañilería y las artesanías (hamacas de seda y poliseda) su padre le enseño a trabajar desde los 10 años de edad, oficio que ahora él lo realiza con presición, todos sus hermanos también realizan el arte de las hamacas.

Él estudio en el pueblo, donde vive hasta el nivel básico, ahora ya cuenta con su propia familia a quienes darles el sustento diario. Hace hamacas de seda y de poliseda, conoce del negocio y le es rentable, las vende en dos ciudades del país y en la comunidad, los días domingos y sábados o según los clientes se lo soliciten. Elabora de 12 a 14  hamacas en el mes.

Actualmente, trabaja con su padre en el cultivo de maíz también,  a sembrado 7,000 metros cuadrados en la comunidad.


Javier compra los materiales (hilo, poliducto, guardacabos y gorros) para la hechura de las hamacas, en la ciudad mas cercana, el cual tiene que viajar por una hora en bus hasta llegar al destino cada ocho días o dependiendo de los encargos (pedidos) que en ocasiones le hacen.

 Solicita un crédito a la fundación Campo para la compra de tres cajas de hilo de seda, guardacabos 40 pares, poliducto,  tres docenas de gorro para la elaboración de las hamacas, el resto lo invertirá en la  agricultura, pues trabaja junto con el padre en los cultivos.

Con el financiamiento, dispondra de los insumos para seguir elaborando hamacas, y aumentar su producción, pues le hacen pedidos en ocasiones y hay que cumplir en los tiempos. Ademas contara con una mayor oferta para los clientes.
A la vez,  mejorara su calidad de vida pues se asegura la alimentación con la producción del maíz, y a la vez obtendra ingresos económicos con las ventas de las hamacas, que le permitirán darle el alimento a su esposa y a su hija.
 sueña crecer poco a poco en las ventas de las hamacas, ademas planea crear en el futuro un negocio ya establecido donde puedan ir a comprar los clientes, también planea construir su  casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Javier, a young man of twenty, full of many dreams, has grown up in a family of entrepreneurs.  He is now the father of a six-month-old girl.  He lives with his daughter and his common-law wife.

His parents taught him the businesses of farming, bricklaying and crafts (hammocks made of natural or artificial silk.)  His father taught him to make hammocks from the age of ten, and now he is very skilled.  All of his brothers also do this type of work.

He went to school in his village and obtained a basic education.  He currently provides a living for his own family.  His hammock business is profitable.  He sells his goods in his local community and in two other cities on Saturdays and Sundays, and also makes them at the request of customers.  He makes 12-14 hammocks each month.

Currently, he also works with his father growing corn.  They are raising 7,000 square meters of this crop in their area.

Javier buys his materials (thread, tubing, thimbles and caps) in the closest city.  He has to travel by bus for one hour to get there.  He goes every eight days, and on other occasions, depending on what orders he has to fill.

He is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo to purchase three boxes of silk thread, 40 pairs of thimbles, three dozen caps and plastic tubing for making hammocks.  He will invest the remainder in agriculture, since he also works alongside his father growing crops.

With the proceeds, he will obtain the supplies he needs so he can continue making hammocks and increase his production.  He has orders and at times needs to fill them on a deadline.  This will also allow him to offer more products to his customers.

At the same time, he will be able to improve his quality of life.  His corn crops will ensure that he can feed his family.  At the same time he will make more income from the sale of his hammocks, which will enable him to provide sustenance to his wife and daughter.

His dream is to grow his sales little by little.  He also wants to create a permanent location for his business where his customers can come to shop.  In addition, he plans to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase three boxes of silk thread, 40 pairs of thimbles, three dozen caps and plastic tubing for making hammocks.  He will invest the remainder in agriculture, since he also works alongside his father growing crops.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es: Ángela, a sus 32 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Nació y creció en el campo, donde sus padres y hermanos mayores le enseñaron las labores agropecuarias, pues es una tradición familiar. Actualmente, tiene un galpón de pollos, donde los cría y engorda para luego venderlos y así generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos; pero desea iniciar con la actividad ganadera, para aprovechar una parcela con pasto de su propiedad, por esa razón y con su actitud emprendedora, solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar ganado (6 terneras de levante), que a mediano plazo le generarán más ingresos y recursos para brindarle a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable y una excelente educación a sus hijos para que sean personas íntegras y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso. Su familia es el motor que mueve a Ángela y, es por ellos que lucha día a día para avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos y metas, especialmente, progresar con la actividad ganadera y que sea lograr que sea perdurable en el tiempo, así tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y mejor bienestar.
texts.en: Ángela, age 32, is a mother of two and in a common-law marriage. She was born and raised in the country, where her parents and older siblings taught her how to work in agriculture; it is a family tradition. She currently has a henhouse where she raises and fattens chickens to later sell. This generates an income so she can support her children, but she wants to start working with livestock in order to make use of a pasture she owns. This is why, with an enterprising attitude, she is requesting a loan. She will use it to buy livestock (6 calves). In some time they will generate more income so that she can provide her family solid economic stability and give her children an excellent education. This will ensure that they become upright people with a prosperous and successful future. Her family is her motor; she fights for them every day. She works hard to move forward and meet her goals. She wants to move forward with the livestock business and make it a solid business. This will allow her to have a better quality of life and better well-being.

loans.use: to buy six calves to raise.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El señor Celso tiene 38 años y está Casado con la señora Tereza quien tiene 34 años, la pareja tiene una hija de 7 años, el motivo de lucha de ambos y por quien se esfuerzan para sacarla adelante.
El señor Celso tiene su propio taller mecánico y su gomería en su casa, comenta también que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre acude hasta su taller por el buen servicio que siempre les da. Es una persona muy trabajadora que sale adelante con sacrificio.
Solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su camión de carga para realizar Fletes de caña de azúcar a la azucarera de Arroyo y Estero y de esa forma poder generar un ingreso extra para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Celso is 38 years old and is married to Tereza, who is 34.  The couple has a 7-year-old daughter.  She is the reason for all of their efforts; they fight to provide her with a better life.

He has his own auto and tire repair shop in his home.  He reports that he has a good base of customers who always come to his shop because of the good service he consistently provides.  He is a hardworking person who is getting ahead through his sacrifice.

He is seeking a loan so that he can perform maintenance on his cargo truck.  This will allow him to make deliveries of sugar to the refineries in the district of Arroyo y Estero.  This will enable him to generate extra income so he can help his family.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his cargo truck.

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
Tem 43 anos de idade, é solteira e tem 1 filho de 28 anos de idade. Estudou até à 10ª classe e trabalha como auxiliar administrativa num tribunal. 
Com este crédito ela pretende comprar cimento, varões de ferro, barrotes, areia e um carrinho de mão para dar continuidade à construção de sua casa iniciada este ano. Ela tem esperança de concluir a construção de sua casa e conseguir mobilá-la. Tem como grande desafio as dificuldades financeiras e o elevado custo de vida e do material de construção pois o seu rendimento é bastante baixo.
texts.en:
Cacilda is 43 years old and single. She has a 28-year-old son. She completed 10th grade and works as an administrative clerk for a court.
With this loan she intends to purchase cement, iron rods, beams and a wheelbarrow in order to continue building her house, which she started this year. She hopes to finish building her house and furnish it. Her big challenge is the financial hardships as well as the high cost of living and construction supplies, since her income is very low.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron rods, beams, sand and a wheelbarrow in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 52-year-old widow. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past 12 years, she has been running a clothing business.
