Fernando es un hombre juicioso, emprendedor, muy enérgico y activo, por eso está en constante búsqueda de opciones que le permitan avanzar, por esa razón solicita el préstamo, para invertirlo en el montaje de un nuevo puesto de trabajo para lo cual requiere comprar una silla de peluquería, tocador con espejo, utensilios de trabajo (barbera, máquina de motilar) y además comprará una máquina para hacer tatuajes, con esto logrará atender de forma más ágil a sus clientes y ofrecerá un nuevo servicio, con lo que aumentará sus ingresos y podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal objetivo, que es montar otras sucursales de su barbería, ofreciendo más oportunidades de empleo y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de otras personas.
texts.en:
Fernando, 21, is single and has no children.  He used to work in a barber shop but, in order to earn more income, decided to set up his own business.  Taking advantage of the experience he had acquired he opened his own barber shop, which has two work stations.  To earn extra income he also sells merchandise such as men's hats and sport shoes.

Fernando is a sensible, very energetic, active entrepreneur who is constantly seeking options to get ahead.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to invest in a new work station, which requires a barber chair, station and mirror, work tools (hair styling and trimming) and a tattoo machine.  This will allow him to be more flexible with his customers and offer them a new service, which will increase his income.  He will also be able to advance toward his goal of opening other barber shops so he can offer more employment opportunities.  This will improve his and other people's lifestyles.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his shop and a tattoo machine.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Basilia tiene 56 años de edad, está  casada con el Sr. Angel, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores, que hoy en día ya la ayudan en lo que pueden.
Ella empezó trabajando en ventas de  ropas por la calle, que daba a  cuotas, luego logro montar una pequeña despensa con mercería en su casa y con el ingreso de su esposo pudieron ir mejorando cada día más, sumado también al esfuerzo que ambos hacen.
Gracias al trabajo que están  realizando pueden mantenerse y ayudar a la educación de sus nietos .Basilia ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta con sus compromisos. Comenta que  siempre trata de buscar mejores precios para sus compras y de esa forma venderle a sus clientes a más bajo costo.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser carne, aceite, arroz, fideo, harina, yerba entre otros insumos para su despensa y seguir dando a sus clientes lo que quieren.
texts.en:
Basilia, 56, is married to Angel and they have three adult children who help out whenever they can.  Basilia started out working as a street vendor selling clothing.  Then she opened a small grocery store at home, and through their combined hard work and income she and her husband were able to improve their situation day by day.

Thanks to their business they are able to support themselve and help educate their grandchildren.  Basilia has proven herself to be a very responsible person and honest in her commitments.  She says she always tries to look for the best prices when making her purchases so she can sell to her customers at the lowest price possible.

She is requesting a loan to buy goods for her store such as meat, oil, rice, noodles, flour, herbs and other items to continue giving her customers what they want.

loans.use: To buy meat, oil, rice, noodles, flour, herbs and other goods.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan esta en pareja hace 7 años, cuenta con su negocio propio en su casa, que es una surtida despensa donde trabaja igualmente con su pareja.
Ellos son una pareja que están luchando por salir adelante e ir creciendo por medio del trabajo digno, quieren que el día de mañana su pequeña despensa sea un gran establecimiento.
Hoy Juan solicita de este crédito para poder comprar productos como balanceados, fardos de fideos, atún, sardina, gaseosas, cervezas, carne y embutidos a fin de surtir mejor su negocio y que de esa forma sus clientes siempre estén conformes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Juan has been in a relationship for seven years and runs his own store out of his home where both he and his partner work.

They are struggling to get ahead by earning a decent living so that one day their little store will be a large establishment.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy products such as pet food, noodles, tuna, sardines, soda, beer, meat and sausage in order to stock his store.  This will keep his customers happy.  He is grateful for this opportunity which will be very helpful to him.

loans.use: To buy pet food, noodles, tuna, sardines, sodas, beer, meat and sausage.

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, a sus 51 años de edad es casada y madre de 7 hijos. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Ella es una mujer emprendedora, pujante y dedicada a su familia, que son su principal motivo para seguir luchando día a día. Actualmente solicita crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ganado de levante (crías de terneras) con el fin de aprovechar el espacio que tiene en la finca donde vive con su familia y criarlos allí, para luego venderlos en las ferias, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que ya tiene experiencia en el sector ganadero; con esto Graciela espera recibir ingresos adicionales para apoyar el sostenimiento económico en su hogar, ya que su esposo es quien lleva la carga completa. Además pretende hacer crecer su negocio ganadero, para que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo y así mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Graciela, 51, is married and has seven children.  She has spent all her life in the country learning livestock farming from her parents.  She is an energetic entrepreneur who is dedicated to her family which is the main reason she struggles day after day.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy calves in order to take advantage of space she has on the family farm where she will raise them to sell at fairs.

Her husband supports her in her work since he has experience in the livestock sector.  Graciela hopes to increase her income to support the household economy since her husband is the one who is in charge of everything now.  She also wants to grow her livestock business to make it profitable and sustainable.  This will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio a sus 23 años de edad es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Desde los 15 años de dedica a laborar como arrendador de caballos, su trabajo consiste en herrarlos y montarlos para luego entregarlos listos a sus dueños para ser montados; esta actividad la alterna con la ganadería y la producción de leche, pues cuenta con algunas cabezas de ganado  y vacas lecheras en un pequeño lote arrendado. Estas actividades las realiza gracias a las enseñanzas de un amigo. Mauricio es un joven dinámico, emprendedor, pujante y con muchas ganas de progresar, por esa razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de más ganado de levante (4 novillones) y 1 vaca productora de leche, de esta manera podrá incrementar su producción y por ende, sus ingresos para poder contribuir a la economía de su hogar. Con esto, Mauricio desea avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, que es tener una parcela propia para tener su ganado y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 23, single and has no children yet. He has been working taming horses since he was fifteen. He shoes them and rides them so that their owners can ride them later. At the same time, he raises meat and milk cattle in a small piece of land he rents. Mauricio learned these activities from a friend.

Mauricio is a dynamic young man. He is enterprising, persistent and has a strong will to get ahead. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to fatten (four castrated bulls) and a milk cow. He will increase his milk production and thus his contribution to the family’s economy. This will be one more step toward the fulfillment of his biggest dream, which is to have his own piece of land where he can raise his cattle, improving his quality of life and offering his family a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to fatten (four castrated bulls) and a milk cow.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Marie from Moriba town Bo. She is married with four children between the ages of 3 years and 15 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

Marie runs a food stand; she sells rice, flour, and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business throughout the week, 10 hours per day.  Marie says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Marie has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasonings, rice and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise even more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasonings, rice and oil for resale

loans.name: Makuti A Group

texts.en:
Veronica, who is in her early 40s, is married with five children of whom all are in school (one is in college and the other four are in secondary). For twenty years now, Veronica has been supporting her family in coordination with her husband by running a 'genge' (small shop) selling fruits and vegetables. She works from 7 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be her 17th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, She used the previous loans to buy more 'genge' items like tomatoes, sacks of onions, coconuts, and more vegetables with high demand. She bought two fridges to put in her new retail shop she opened. With the profit from the business, Veronica paid school fees for her children and also home expenses. She will use this loan to buy the missing 'genge' items. She dreams that one day she will be able to own a wholesale business.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Makuti A" which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the missing items for her small shop.

loans.name: Agano Group

texts.en:
Delister, who is in her 30s, is married with one daughter who is in school. For five years now, Delister has had a retail shop with different activities: telephone money transfer (M-pesa, Tigo pesa, Airtel Money), selling airtime and selling telephone accessories. She is doing fine with her business.
She works from 6 am to 11:30 pm daily and is able to make a very good profit per month.

This will be her 10th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, she opened her current M-pesa business, repaired her business premises, bought business equipment like a computer and a cupboard, and put an aluminum door on her business premises. 

With the profit, she bought a plot of land, paid school fees, paid part of home expenses and reinvested back into the business.  She will use this loan to open another telephone money transfer (M-pesa). She dreams of expanding her business a lot. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "AGANO" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open another telephone money transfer service (M-pesa).

loans.name: Gifty's Group

texts.en:
Gifty's group is comprised of eight members who live in the same neighborhood. It is the seventh time that this group is requesting financial support from ID-Ghana in order to raise its level of activity. 

Gifty, the group's representative, is 44 years old and married to a man named Alex with whom she has two children. Both children are in school and are their dependents. Gifty lives with her husband and children and jointly takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.

Gifty did not go to school but received non-formal education called adult education. She can read and write therefore, which gives her the privilege to transact business with her customers. In order to contribute to the household's various expenses, she has been selling cooking utensils, silver products and plastic chairs, from her home, for the past twenty years. These products are procured from the market at wholesale prices.

In order to satisfy the needs of her customers, and to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting this loan from Kiva through ID-Ghana, along with the other members of Gifty's group. Their previous loans were duly repaid without problem. They need a total amount of GHS 6700 to be able to serve their customers better.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils, silver products and plastic chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some improvements to her establishment, buy materials to enlarge the chicken pen and buy a stainless steel table.

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Rebeca, who is in her early 30s, is married with two sons; one of them is in school. The remaining boy is still a baby. Since 2006, Rebeca has been running two businesses named Genge-Duka selling fruits and vegetables, soft drinks, beers, sugar, fabrics, sarongs and a charcoal business. She works from 7 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good return per month.

This will be her 10th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, she opened a fruit and vegetable business and built business premises where she now expects to have electricity connection; previously, she was renting  premises. With the profit received, she covered school fees, household expenses and started building a house.  She will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and pay for electricity connection in her new business premises. She dreams of owning a big business and growing to a position where she can take her own big loan instead of participating in a group loan. 

Rebeca will share this loan with her loan group" Uvumilivu" which consists of eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and pay for electricity connection in her new business premises.

loans.name: Mahawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Mahawa from Moriba town Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 15. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

Mahawa runs a general stock business; she sells soft drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and sweets. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business throughout the week and 12 hours per day.  Mahawa says that at present her business is doing well.

Mahawa has requested a loan to purchase soft drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and sweets to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise even more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and sweets to sell

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Aneth, who is in her late 30s, is married with three daughters who are in school. For five years now, Aneth has been running a canteen selling different kinds of food: lunch food (rice with beans, meats, ugali), breakfast (tea with bites) and soft drinks. She is doing fine with her business. She works from 6 am to 5 pm daily, and is able to make a good profit in a month. 

This will be her ninth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock more food items along with soft drinks, and has paid back all her loans successfully. With the profit received, she covered school fees and reinvested in the business. She will use this loan to buy a refrigerator for her business.  

Aneth dreams that one day,  she will be able to offer more food services to her food enterprise. 

She will share this loan with her loan group," UNITY", which consists of 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her business.
